review: Fast Check in, Security screening and immigration at BKK airport. Boarding well organized. The B738 was one of the refurbished planes with a free and bright interior. Food decent for this 2h flight. Flight attendants friendly. Just a few blanket available for the 150+ pax on this very cold flight. Overall recommended

I’m travelling with a small child and baby solo, the airline crew was very unhelpful and rude to my family. They refused to let me bring my baby jogger travel pram on the plane despite me having purchased two business class seats. This was my only carry on and they still refused to let me bring it saying there was not space. I had paid for the space with my tickets. I do not recommend using this airline if you have small kids based on my experience.

route: Auckland to Kuching via Kuala Lumpur
review: Worst airline ever, requested extra leg room for both flights. Stuffed up both. Seat 28a, 28c on A330-300 and return flight 28c / 28h. They charge people $70 per seat upgrade paid you $280 on my exit row seats. Some how ground staff muck around on both flights and staff don't fix their mistakes.

route: Sydney to London via Kuala Lumpur
review: SYD to LHR via KUL. A333 older aircraft,  touch screen poor. Cabin crew great, food quality improved. KUL to LHR A359 newer aircraft, quiet and crew very good. Food quality very good Champagne Duval Leroy good, other wines could be improved. Kabuli Pulao / Ayam Perchek excellent. MAS has certainly improved.

route: Perth to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: We flew 5 Malaysia Airlines flights in 1 week. Every flight was delayed some by 7 hrs or more. Cabin staff were surly. We booked extra luggage and they dropped it from the return flights and tried charging 700USD to take the amount we had already paid for. They were a good airline, but I will never fly them again.
Good cabin and friendly cabin crew, but limited on entertainment movies. Ground staff very helpful, delicious food

route: Heathrow to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: Horrible experience. My flight was cancelled 3 times over 3 different days and on the last day the flight they put me on had a crazy long layover. The service was unacceptable too. Avoid this airline.

We’re travelling as a family with my nonverbal autistic son. During checked in, I showed them our GB Pockit pram with a non GB Pockit bag. The check in staff gave us an all okay to use this and can be kept in the overhead cabin as well. Unfortunately the flight attendant on the plane lectured us that it is not acceptable and was telling me that this can be offloaded because it was not safe. I have used the same pram and bag in Singapore Airlines with no problems at all and I made the due diligence to ask in the check in counter as well. What I didn’t like was the manner and attitude of this flight attendant in dealing with us. I don’t want to argue anymore because it’s already stressful traveling with a nonverbal autistic toddler. My husband and I were anxious whole flight it was a traumatic experience and MAS should train their staff on how to deal with passengers with special kids. I was expecting some empathy considering that their check in staff said it’s all good to bring on board. Appalling and disgusting experience overall!

Boarding well organized, flight slightly delayed due to heavy air traffic in BKK. Friendly welcome by purser, was addressed by name throughout the flight. New upgraded cabin with comfortable seats and well functioning streaming IFE with an IPad holder where the screen used to be, good choice of movies. The usual good and hearty Malay catering. MH started giving out beer for flights under 3hours. Friendly and efficient staff, highly recommended.
Fast and efficient checkin, immigration and security services. Boarding well organized, flight uneventful, on time, they even served a snack and water on this 45 min flight; recommended!

Ground service was great with seamless self check-in and baggage drop counter, definitely faster than conventional ones. Boarding began 20 minutes prior to departure and the flight departed on-time. The cabin crew were friendly and welcoming. I had the new narrowbody interior without IFE. Instead, wireless IFE was provided called MHStudio. I must admit it was absolutely annoying trying to connect to the WiFi and watch movie without buffers and lag. I only managed to watch the movie 45 minutes into the flight. I was too frustrated and exhausted to watch anything and went to sleep instead. The seat was quite uncomfortably hard and narrow. On the positive side, the lasagna did not disappoint me, although I wished the portion was larger.

route: Bangkok to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur
review: Checkin, security check and immigration at BKK airport fast and efficient. The aircraft had been recently refurbished, and looks bright, clean an comfortable. New wifi based entertainment system on own device worked well, with a decent choice of entertainment options. There were 3 meal options on this 2h flight, which was good in quantity and quality. Service was impeccable. Transit in KL was smooth, short flight to Singapore touched down 20 min ahead of schedule. The only negative point was that my high upgrade bid was unsuccessful, despite a half empty business class section. Overall, highly recommended

The flight stewardess (Farra Deyana) was outstanding in her service. She even recognised that I flew in her fight a few days ago from Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. She even remembered the drink I ordered. That shows the wholehearted service by this crew member. I was really impressed with her quality service in both flights.

The flight from Hanoi to Kuala Lumpur was smooth. The cabin crew were attentive. The food was good. They installed a new seat with no in-flight display screen but you can use your phone and tablet to watch movies etc after connected to wifi.

Check-in was very smooth. The Marhaba lounge was basic but comfortable. The boarding process for business class passengers was muddly as there was no clear queue. Once onboard the welcome was friendly and I was pleased that there was a vegetarian version of the satay offered to all passengers early in the flight. All the vegetarian food served was of a high quality. Seating was 1-2-2 across the cabin. The pairs of seats by the window were narrower than the others and had less storage space - best to avoid these. Strangely there were no signs to indicate whether the toilets were occupied. The plane operated close to time. Overall a good experience for the price.

Terrible ground service for connecting flight. The first leg flight landed late due to bad weather, told the cabin crew and ground staff that we have connecting flight in 30 minutes. The cabin crew actually did help by informing the ground staff, however there were no ground staff waiting for us at our arrival gate. We had to ask a ground staff that passes by, but were no good help anyway. We were struggling to follow the airport signage heading to the connecting flight gate, but we made it at least. Fortunately, the connecting flight also delayed due to the weather (by 40 minutes!). The flight itself was great, cabin crew were friendly and the food served was delicious. The seat is quite hard and the IFE is sometime unresponsive. Overall, a mediocre flight.

Boarding was efficient and seamless. Got the IFE interior but I was too tired to watch any movies, only open the flight info display and slept most of the flight. The noodle with chicken was surprisingly excellent after having it several times over the years. However, the rest of the meal (bun, fruit, and pudding) was decent at best (could be worse I guess). The cabin crew were very friendly, though they were quite busy as there were VIPs in the flight.

The flight was on time and boarding went smoothly. The cabin crews were friendly and provided excellent hospitality. The interior of the flight was new and I like the blue color. The seat was pretty hard and it does not have headrest which is a shame. Legroom were fine for a 5'8 guy despite more seats than the previous interior. USB charging ports are available for each seat, but cannot be used during takeoff and landing. The airline replaced its IFE with MHstudio, which is a web-based streaming platform. You have to use your own device, connect to the inflight WIFI (pretty laggy), and open the website to enjoy the entertainments available. Options were great for movies, TV shows, and music. Unfortunately, there is no flight information visual display. The meal I chose was Salmon Frittata and it was pretty disappointing. The portion of the frittata was about 20% of the whole meal, along with one sausage and potato wedges. The pineapple bun and yogurt was decent. The fruit and salted peanut was the star of the meal.

The flight was delayed for about 30 minutes due to bad weather. Onboard is the old interior with IFE installed. Seat was slightly hard, and the IFE is sort of responsive. The cabin crew were great despite the late evening flight. Once cruising, the crew serves dinner where I chose chicken with rice. The meal was decent, hot rice and nicely cooked chicken, but slightly bland. The marble cake and salted peanut was excellent (as usual). Overall, the flight was decent for the airline's standard.

When arriving to destination, I noticed that the clothes in my suitcase were wet. My suitcase has a double zip and is a top brand. I remember the captain telling us in KUL that the flight was delayed due to heavy rain and delays in loading the luggage despite boarding completed. Also initially the flight was delayed by 2 hours. I send a message to Malaysia Airlines with photo of the wet clothes. They answered that they did not find any evidence on their side (meaning I was lying?) and that MA will not pay any compensation, that I never ask for. The only objective of my message was to improve passenger luggage handling. It's not about to happen in the future. So after 2 and half hours delay, we start the flight to Langkawi, and we get a small bag of peanuts and a bottle water.
All good, but food wasn't great and no entertainment on this flight. This is poor from Malaysia who are trying to cost cut probably due to pressures from AirAsia.

I recently traveled on Malaysia Airlines from Auckland to Colombo, and I wanted to share my feedback about my experience. The check-in process in Auckland was smooth and efficient, which was appreciated. I had booked and paid for extra legroom seats, but I noticed that many of the front-end extra seats were empty throughout the flight. This was disappointing as I had specifically paid extra for these seats for comfort. Furthermore, there was a problem with the entertainment unit in my seat, as the touch system was not functioning properly. Despite informing the flight attendants about the issue, I was told that it couldn't be fixed. As a result, I requested to move to a different seat with a functioning entertainment system. However, I was informed that there were no seats available, even though I noticed that there were empty seats in the front rows. I also observed a lady with an infant who was seated in front of us. Her mother, who was supposed to be seated in the front row with the infant bassinet, was moving around, leaving the infant unattended. I requested the flight attendant to ask the lady to return to her allocated seat so that we could use the empty seat for a working entertainment system. However, I was informed that they were unable to ask her to move. Overall, I was disappointed with the lack of assistance and the unavailability of the seats despite the circumstances.

My husband and I passed through Kuala Lumpur Airport on the last day of our honeymoon and had one of the worst days of our lives due to Malaysia Airlines and their terrible transfer desk and staff. Our flight was booked through SriLankan Airlines but the final flight was scheduled to be operated by Malaysia Airlines. At the check in desk in Male, Maldives, the Sri Lanka Airlines representative gave us the boarding passes for our first two flights and informed us we needed to ‘pick up the boarding passes for our third flight at the transfer desk in Colombo or Kuala Lumpur’. The rep did not say we weren’t checked in for this third flight, and confirmed our luggage was also due to make the full journey across the three flights without the need for us to collect or recheck baggage. At the Colombo Airport transfer desk the staff member told us we needed to collect our boarding passes in Kuala Lumpur, which was surprising as this information differed from what the first Sri Lanka Airlines rep told us in Male. Our flight from Colombo to KL landed around 25 minutes late and it then took around 15 minutes to disembark and reach the transfer desk at KLIA. We immediately went to the desk and got there around 7.40am. We spoke to someone on the right side of the desk (separate to the Malaysia Airlines section), and they asked to see our flight itinerary. Given our flight was due to be operated by Malaysia Airlines and the staff member had started serving someone else, we then saw there was a separate transfer desk for Malaysia Airlines. We immediately headed to the long queue at around 7.50am. Although the line was long, we expected it would move at a reasonable pace. After taking turns in the line to use the restroom, when my husband and I were both in the line waiting together we soon realised it was not moving. There was one staff member serving the huge number of passengers and seemingly requiring 10 minutes or more per passenger. We heard others around us talk of their flight time with the two women in front of us saying their flight was prior to ours. Passengers were pushing in the line with disorder in the queue. Many people jumped the line saying they still needed to check in or had children. There was also a very large group being served in one line and they appeared to be at the front of the queue for almost the entire time we were waiting. By the time we finally reached the front of the line around 9am, the staff member rudely spoke to us and told us we missed check in 25 minutes prior. We told her we were waiting over an hour in the queue to which she said she called our names, and she accused us of not being in the queue the entire time.  The staff provided no resolution for us but to rebook our flights, so we proceeded to the gate regardless and again were turned away despite our gate still being open. We were given no option to board our flight.

route: Amritsar to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: I booked Asian vegetarian meal both ways however we were offered Hindu veg meal on 2 flights and non veg meal on return flights. Due to that none of us could eat anything excepts some fruits and croissants. Before my return i requested to have my meal changed to jain veg meals so we wont get meat served and on the ticket counter at Amritsar and again at Kuala Lumpur the staff confirmed that our jain meal is confirmed in system however in flight we were served with non veg meals both times . 2) on our arrival to India the whole flight missed their checked baggage's and my family received our baggage's a week after we reached India. In total 7 checked baggage were missing for more than a week before we received them. It had all our clothes, baby food, nappies etc. I had to buy  everything including clothes (had wedding to attend) . We did not had anything with us as the aircraft from Kuala Lumpur to Amritsar was too small that staff had to put out carry bags with checked in luggage. Myself and my kids went out of airport with no jacket. Kuala Lumpur-Amritsar staff was very rude to all the passengers. As it was a very small plane there were no bassinets. Having a baby on lap i was unable to open the flap to keep the food tray and requested crew if i could sit at different seat as there were few lines which were totally empty for dinner as it will be easier for me to eat and keep my 1 year old baby on other seat. The crew bluntly refused and told me i am only allowed to use the seat i paid for. The solution i was offered was that my wife can eat whatever she could eat out of her plate while i hold the baby and then she can hold the child so that i can open the flap to put my tray and eat. When the meal was served (Hindu meal with chicken in it) out of it we could only eat fruits and dessert. For the above issues i put a complaint and filled feedback form which airline sent me but never heard anything back. For my return flight Amritsar to Kuala Lumpur i booked my seats in advance and paid for it so i don't have to go through the same. When i got my boarding pass the seats were different. When i requested to have the seat i paid for staff at airport could not do as they have already given those seats to someone else. So we had to suffer the same thing but at least crew was very accommodating except they could not find us any veg meal. On our return flight from Kuala Lumpur to Sydney was cancelled and we were given new boarding passes as we came out of the flight from Amritsar to Kuala Lumpur. They also provided us with breakfast vouchers, hotel. In my new boarding pass we didn’t receive bassinet as it was confirmed in my flight ticket. I approached transfer counter to confirm if we still have bassinet. the staff told me we don't have it and i need to pay for it. I had to beg the staff to give bassinet as its not our fault that flight is been cancelled. Finally after some time they decided to provide my wife with bassinet but we had to sit in different compartments now.

Overall, the flight was great with very friendly and nice crews on both my return flights. There was once when we flew over the Indonesian airspace and the turbulence was quite bad and felt like dying, the crews were very attentive and look out for me a lot. I am seriously very touched about it. Entertainment wise was alright, they have some blockbuster movies, overall it was okay. During my 8 hours flight, I was given 1 hot meal, 1 snack such as pastry or sandwiches and also the famous MAS peanuts. The food option was great as well. The cabin cleanliness was good especially the toilet. I was also given blanket and pillow during the flight.
Very bad customer service. Entertainment was not working, they gave us 25% to use with in 6 months which is unfair. Very slow answering the requests, and the food is bad.

Flight left on time and arrived on time. Food and drink was terrific and customer service was excellent. Perfect brewed Coffee - best I have ever had on an airplane. Why do they not advertise alcohol? If you ask you get! Asked and they had Beer, Wine, Spirits and Champagne. Business Class seats are old fashioned style, not luxurious and basic in design. Lie flat bed was very uncomfortable. Seats were worn out and looked like they badly needed a refresh / upgrade. There was no Onboard Wi-Fi or Internet over the whole 10 hour flight.

Short flight just under 2 hours. Only 3 rows of business class seats (4 seats across in 2 x 2) My wife and I were in 2 D & F. We were offered a choice of 3 main meals, requested our choice and were then told none left. How can the 1st row and the last row get served first and the middle row left to last! No TV, No Audio (must bring your own!)

route: Auckland to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: I booked two tickets for my mother and my sister to travel from Chennai to New Zealand. They came to NZ without any problem, however, there was no wheel chair assistance given. When going back i called Malaysia Airlines to ask them to cancel my sisters ticket and keep my mothers ticket as it is because only she will be travelling and i made sure i booked a flexi ticket so i can cancel anytime. When i spoke to the agent she said she has cancelled the ticket for my sister and had my mums kept as it is. But two days before my mothers travel i went online to check the ticket i found that her ticket was kept on hold. So i called the Airlines and they said its been cancelled. I asked them why and they said I requested it to be cancelled. After a day of fight with them and language barrier of them not understanding English properly they found out that its was the 1st agents mistake as she cancelled both the ticket instead. So, i had to rebook the ticket just one day before the travel which was so expensive. And my mother couldn't be in NZ as she was in visitor visa and had to leave the country in a day. Now the airlines knows that its their mistake and took the complaint but they are not refunding the excess money i paid because of the last minute tickets which would be close to $700 to $800 NZD. Its been three months now and they said they will get back in 40 days which was in the beginning of January to be exact 4th of January. We would have made numerous number of calls to the airline and no one are able to give a proper answer and they kept saying their manager would call back which has not happened till now.

No boarding pass issued after online check in. Itinerary does not use proper English or Philippines abbreviations baggage limits. Waste of time on this airline and needed to haul baggage down stairs to gate. Gate at Manila Airport was extremely hot without air conditioning in February. The manager screamed and said it was not her job to provide customer support. No snacks, beverages or water at the gate even if it’s delayed.

Great flight. Choice of lounges at Heathrow - Gulf Air or Qatar. We chose Qatar Airways lounge and although very busy enjoyed a lovely expresso martini at the cocktail area. Boarding was on time and we were greeted by very friendly cabin crew and shown to our seats. I had selected 4A and 6A as they offer more privacy. Welcome drinks were offered and then shortly after take off the famous satay snack offering. Flight was very comfortable but what really stood out for me was the exemplary cabin crew - courteous, smiling, engaging probably the best cabin crew I have encountered in my travels. Used the complimentary wi-fi which was excellent. Catering offered Malay and European dishes along with nice drinks selection. The only let down for me was the IFE film selection, not many new movies and a lot of children's movies. Despite the IFE issue I would 100% fly this airline again. Our return flight and several domestic flights were also excellent.

I had a flight at 23:15 on March 3, but it was delayed 5 and a half hours to 4:45 am in the morning. As a result, I had to miss my Monday morning meeting and felt groggy all day. They did not provide a re-routing flight or offer a hotel in the terminal where I can rest. I had to stay in a noisy, smelly, and crowded Golden Lounge for 7 hours of waiting with screaming kids and loud guests - the worst business lounge in the world. There was only one staff handling hundreds of angry customers and from 22:21, I had to wait very long before I could ask for a re-routing flight with Korean Air at 23:50. By then, it was too late and the flight was full.  The staff was rude and unhelpful. This is the third time in my last trip that the flight has been delayed for 5 hours. It is impossible to schedule meetings since the management is totally incompetent and they do not have enough planes to cover all their routes.

Flight delayed with no communication on how long and now stuck in this hot box of a waiting area. Service has been sub standard the whole time. Flight here was equally as woeful with poor food and waking people up at 3am. Seems like Malaysian hospitality no longer means much. No preferential treatment for one world status which seems to be a dishonor of being a part of the group. Would not fly again by choice.

This my second time flying with Malaysian Airlines since the Covid. Their services have certainly improved. I found them to be more attentive and responsive than prior to Covid. Food, is as usual, more than sufficient and tasty. Considering that they have to handle a crowded plane, I must commend them for their patience and efficiency. All in all, they deserved to be commended for their improved services. My only criticism is that their widely advertised Free Wifi is dysfunctional, or non-existent.

route: Perth to Kuala Lumpur via Mandurah
review: Just absolutely rubbish, cancelled flight with no information provided. Unfriendly staff who don't make any effort to help you. Come back the next day after the cancelled flight to find myself sitting in the aircraft because of technical difficulties. Waiting for that one to be cancelled now. Obviously unsafe aircraft if they are having technical difficulties all the times.

I had two flights to get from Hanoi to Perth. The first flight from Hanoi to KL. was cancelled due to technical issues. I was rebooked 24 hours later. Eventually made it to KL to have the second leg cancelled due to technical difficulties. Another overnight delay. Hotels were provided but only after very long waits and not well organised. I wonder if they have any planes that don’t have technical problems as I certainly didn’t get one.
Terrible, delayed due to bag offload and no air-conditioning on plane, like sauna. Terrible experience and shame as a country have such airline.

Bad quality food, fruit salad served not ripe and unfit for consumption. Cabin staff reluctant to serve hot drinks on an 8-hour flight, use the seat belt sign ON as an excuse, even when there is no turbulence. I have not flown on a flight with the seat belt sign ON unnecessarily by the captain for 6 out of 8 hours, when there was turbulence only for a limited time 30 minutes.  It happened on the outbound flight too SYD-KUL they used the same tactic seat bet sign ON and no hot drinks served and I gave them the benefit of the doubt.  Forced to accept rice breakfast on passengers which we are not used to with no other choice. We were seated in the front section of the cabin and the attitude was take it or leave it.  Wine was served in a leaky plastic cup, when requested for another glass, they just added another cup below the leaky cup. How do you drink wine with 2 cups?  Old entertainment system small selection of movies, the Captain and cabin staff have no concerns about damage to ears with announcements through the headphones which happens unnoticed.

I was pleasantly surprised by Malaysia airlines. The food was great, especially chicken in soy sauce. There was free WiFi and drinks incl alcoholic drinks. The cabin was clean and in immaculate condition. The service was super responsive.

Really enjoyed a red-eye flight. Overall food was decent with chicken kebab for supper and a delicious nasi lemak for breakfast. The seat was comfortable but average in flight entertainment. The cabin crew were friendly, welcoming and cheerful. The overall boarding process was handled professionally.

route: London to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: I had a real smooth flight with Malaysia airlines. The food is excellent and the cabin crew are very friendly. I had a slight annoyance prior to departure which I wanted to mention. Malaysia Airlines has a programme where you can bid for an upgraded seat which I decided to do and I wish I never did. You find out 24hours before whether you have been successful. However it meant that I couldn’t check in on the website prior to departure. I like to have an aisle seat, so I make sure I check in. I couldn’t do that and I ended up with a middle seat. Which I was annoyed at, but overall the flight was still fine. I had a two hour delay connecting onward to Bangkok. Still I find them a fantastic airline.

Worst customer service on check in. Online check-in was not available in 2024. The counter staff was not accommodating and made me run in a circle and did not assist in any way, they were rude, blunt even the manager. She was very demanding and raised her voice. I felt threatened as a passenger would not recommend flying. It’s not a first class or four-star airline.

route: Melbourne to Tokyo via Kuala Lumpur
review: I am a photographer traveling to Melbourne, and the airline informed me that I cannot carry my camera gear as carry-on because it is overweight. They suggested I purchase an additional checked bag, but they asked for payment based on weight, amounting to 400 AUD. This is more expensive than buying a new ticket, which is what I ended up doing in the end. I understand there are additional charges but basing it on weight when it is less than a 23kg additional checked luggage is ridiculous!

Flew business class domestic. A 50 minutes flight time. The seat was good, padding was soft and for less than one hour flight it was very confortable. Not sure for much longer flight. The crew was efficient, warm and welcoming. Satay and cold beverages were served for this short flight which was very good. The departure was a little bit behind schedule due to the congestion at KLIA and obviously not the airlines fault. Its not a 5 star service BUT definitely 4 or 4.5 star. Very high customer value for the price paid.

route: Bangkok to London Heathrow via Kuala Lumpur
review: This was my fourth trip flying with Malaysia Airlines and still they are the best airline I have ever flown with. The seats are comfy, food was tasty and staff very friendly. My first flight was a two hour flight from Bangkok to Kuala Lumpur. Fine no problems for a two hour hop. The flight from KUL to Heathrow was just short of 14 hours. Initially I thought I was going to really struggle with the length of this flight. However I had no issues and it didn’t drag at all. What is very handy is having access to all your messaging apps. That is brilliant and you can waste a few hours talking to friends or family. I was extremely impressed all round. I will happily fly with them again.

When I made the booking the aircraft was an A350 but was later changed to an A330. Check-in was busy but OK. Marhaba lounge was basic. Boarding was delayed and take off a little bit late. The crew in my cabin were excellent, very engaging and proactive. Announcements onboard were the clearest I have ever heard on a flight. Food choices were not too appealing except for the satay. Drinks and snacks were offered throughout the flight. No Wi-Fi. IFE could be improved both in content and operation. For some reason MAS tends to leave the seat belt sign on for extended periods way after any turbulence is felt. I have noticed this on many of their flights. Luggage arrived promptly. Overall pretty good Malaysian hospitality.

route: Kathmandu to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: One of the worst airlines I travelled with. I was flying from Sydney to Kathmandu via Kuala Lumpur on 21st December. Flight was delayed. The Sydney international airport staff were unhelpful, no communication and the checkin process was absolutely terrible. The flight was delayed by 9 hours. Reached KL, the transit staff said the hotel was 1 hour away from the airport which was provisioned for the passengers on this delayed flight. Upon returning, in Kathmandu flight delayed..again no communication. Paid for a lounge and came to the gate as expected however got stuck at the gate with the delayed flight. This was the first time I flew Malaysia Airlines  and will never do it again.

I had a return flight with this airline. First trip was on December 26th, all the way through the day it was postponements after postpones. Even leaving there was a delay. It meant I was at the airport far longer than. When arriving at my destination my bags were lost. My first 3 days on my cruise I had to stay in my room as all my clothes were lost. The cruise didn't have clothes that fit me so I had to wait till we dokc for me to pick up my luggage. The trip back on Jan 5 was a horrible experience. I am a big lad and the seats are a lot smaller than other airlines I had. The food was so bad I gave it back uneaten and just had the water. The flight had no onboard entertainment, like 10 hour flight trying to entertain ourselves.

route: Mumbai to Tokyo via Kuala Lumpur
review: Passengers stranded for hours at check in queue. Very unprofessional and rude staff at counters not cooperating with passengers. There was no intimation or written mention about number of pieces of carry on baggage allowed. Passengers carrying 2 pieces were stopped by the staff and made to adjust the luggage. This has sparked a dispute between many passengers and staff members, who were extremely unprofessional and rude with coordinating with passengers. Horrible experience. A total nightmare. Check in was delayed by more than 2 hours!

MH192 flight number on 1st January 2024 departed 1 hr 6 mins late from KUL. When I asked the flight attendant to move my cabin luggage in the compartment she denied saying you need to keep the luggage by yourself while the plane was overcrowded. The seats were randomly distributed in the flight, husband and wife aren’t sitting together, there was complaints. When I asked for my dinner in the four hour flight which was already delayed for 1.5 hour adding up to 5hours 30 mins she said food is on priority basis. Food was served after 2 hours of flight.

route: Kathmandu to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: I was going from Kathmandu to Bali with a transit in KL in December. Unfortunately, I left my hand carry suitcase at the gate before boarding the flight from KL to Denpasar-Bali. As soon as the mistake was realised, I informed the cabin crew, but the plane had already started pushing back. The crew was extremely friendly and assured me that I would be getting the suitcase back, and that they had contacted ground staff at KLIA. However after landing in Bali. I went to the lost and found at Denpasar airport in Bali, where the person had no idea how to contact anyone at KL or Malaysia Airlines to inquire about the luggage I left. I was told to fill out a form, which I did. (Looking back now if I had done nothing else other than fill out the form, I would never have gotten any information about my suitcase.) Throughout the next few days I repeatedly called Malaysia Airlines numbers, and none of them ever picked up. I was by the phone for hours at a time. Finally, one number picked up, but I was told the person had no idea what to do about my suitcase, and that it wasn't at Malaysia Airlines' lost and found at KL. After numerous calls, I finally got a hold of another person who directed me to AeroDarat, and said that my suitcase might be at their lost and found. The earlier person could have told me that there was more than one lost and found, and that I should call the other ones to check, but didn't. Thank god I found out about the other lost and found.  Once i got aerodarat's number, Aerodarat didnt pick up numerous times, but once they finally did i found out my luggage was indeed with them. They said i could get it when i transited at KL again on the way back to Kathmandu. Howver, when i was at KL again the person at the help desk said the Aerodarat lost and found was beyond immigration. As we didn't have a visa to enter Malaysia, I told the person i couldn't go past immigration to retrieve my case, to which the person kept responding that i should still go. Then they said they couldnt do anything beyond that. Another lady at the help desk also couldn't do anything, and even got mad at us. Finally, a man came and understood that we couldn't cross immigration, so he said our suitcase would be brought to us at the gate before our next flight. Finally, I got my case back at the gate. I never got ANY email or anything acknowledging that i had filled out the form which the staff told me to fill out. If not for my constant calling, i would never have retrieved my suitcase. the form was completely useless. This experience was unfortunate, as the cabin crew and in flight service was splendid. However, like I said Malaysia Airlines needs to change up it's ground service and lost and found services thoroughly. I will not be flying with Malaysia Airlines again.

route: Colombo to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: Malaysian flight get delayed. Second Flight from transit to BKK very poor condition. No leg space. No entertainment, poor meals. When we try return we came to final boarding desk about 10-15 min before departure they didn't allow us to enter.  We had to book different airline tickets.

My flight no was MH 182 from Kuala Lumpur to Chennai on 31 Dec 2023. It was an awesome experience, the cabin crew was just awesome and the food provided was very tasty. A special thanks to one of the cabin crew, Mr Shivan, thanks to his hospitality

route: Perth to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: I have been flying through Malaysia Airlines for a while but after this incident may have to reconsider. After booking tickets we checked with the customer service personnel to add in more baggage allowance. The Airline customer service personnel advised that to add in 10 Kg it costs only $15AUD more. However, there is an additional penalty of $150 AUD to modify them. It is a shame to rip off its customers with an additional $150AUD charge for such a small change request. This Airlines will not be our preferred Airline for travelling from next time onwards.

Bought the Value bundle on the app and it had not given date but automatically added the bundle to the return flight, called MAS and was told that it’s not refundable and that I’m not able to just change the bundle to the flying out day. Don’t ever fly with Malaysia Airlines. The worst airlines out there. They don’t refund, change anything.
A very nice flight. Boarding process was quick. Flight was however delayed. The meal chicken could have been better. I liked the onboard wifi streaming.

route: Osaka to Singapore via Kuala Lumpur
review: If I can rate negative 5 stars I would. A simple travel route from Osaka to Singapore should be less than 7 hours. Instead, 24 hours later I’m still stuck in KL airport. First flight from Osaka to Kuala Lumpur was diverted to Ho Chi Min due to engine issue. The ground staff was messy and disorganized, took very long to get things sorted. They booked a bunch of passengers on connecting flights that there’s no way we can make it in time, especially when the flight from Vietnam to Kuala Lumpur was delayed because they took very long to sort out all the passengers. Passengers with different final destinations all realized we missed our flight upon landing and were forced to stay overnight in KL. The transport arranged by the airline didn’t turn up to pick us up from the hotel to the airport in morning. Avoid this airline!

route: New Delhi to Perth via Kaula Lumpur
review: Really bad experience, the seats and aircraft are too congested. No space to move. Staff at Kaula Lumpur airport are of no help at all.  You have to keep chasing them for any kind of assistance required. Its the 2nd time I have travelled and both experience have been very bad. I wouldn't travel by Malaysia Airlines again.

The entire crew helped me search for my lost watch an Omega Constellation. They exceeded my expectations in their efforts to secure my watch. Kudos to Malaysia Airlines crew of flight from KUL to NRT on the 25 November 2023. As a family, MH has always been our chosen carrier and we have had good overall experience with the airline.

Four flights in six days (2 x transfers), all flights delayed. Kuala Lumpur to Singapore 17 December arrived on time. Two of the flights have air-conditioning that aren’t working well. My baggage mishandled. Notified to arrive and delivered the next day. First and last time on Malaysia Airlines.
Air conditioner wasn’t working very well, most people were sweating a lot on the plane. Mishandled my baggage, still haven’t found until now. The flight was delayed for one hour.

Malaysia Airlines codeshare on Turkish Airlines from Stuttgart to Penang via Istanbul and Kuala Lumpur. Last leg with Malaysia Airlines. Not sure who came up with this codeshare partnership but it's half baked. You get an email to check in on the TK site but they don't give you the TK ticket number and PNR. And of course their link does not work. Once you have that - through the TK customer service line you will find out that you still can't reserve a seat or check in online - explanation - because it's a code share. How stupid is that? And wee had a 2 hour delay in KUL to top it all off.

Not the best airline, definitely not my top 10. Sat on defective seats again, when my seat is being reclined it comes back up by itself in the slightest turbulence causing to disturb my nap. Food was terrible, uncomfortable seats and terrible WiFi. At least they delivered our luggage after they nearly lost ours once many years ago.

Smooth journey on both intercontinental legs and a couple of domestic flights in between. All flights on time, and requested seats honoured on all. Seats supportive and comfortable for price. Food decent portions and quite tasty for an econ offering. Alcohol seems limited to beer or wine in econ, but no problem asking for refills, plus soft drinks readily available. Staff very courteous. Baggage reclaim was prompt, even at LHR on return. Since the demise of the B747s and A380s on this route, load factors are high, and as with B787s, the A350 seems cramped and poky , but I understand the need for utiliising more efficient planes. Overall a recommended journey, and, being direct, saves the hassle of changing planes in the middle east.

route: London  to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: I flew Malaysia Airlines LHR-SYD (via KUL), economy class out and business class return. All 4 of my flights were good, with the cabin staff very attentive and caring. I have a severe food allergy and maximum care was taken to ensure I was not put at risk in any way. The ground staff at the various airports were also very helpful. I am a nervous flyer, but thanks to Malaysian Airlines, my trips were not stressful at all as I felt cared for throughout. Our take offs and landings were so smooth so I had no cause for concern throughout the journeys. Thank you Malaysian Airlines!

route: Hyderabad to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Initially the system didn’t work and they wrote down boarding passes manually and had to wait for hours to clear that and even no one informed until that time. The connecting flight got missed and they said they will arrange to next flight, which is at night. They took our passports to arrange special pass and they came back with the pass after 5:30 hours. After 5:30 they came up and took another 2 hours for passes and transportation. They didn’t even provide a meal.  After all the wait we reached the hotel and stayed for 1 hr and they started us to go back to airport. After all the hassle in flight I have requested for hindu vegetarian meal and they didn’t change it in the new flight and they didn’t bother to apologise nor provide any alternative. They didn’t even have anything to provide food in flight. There said there was no option for veg and no food provided. After all these things my check in bag got missing and they couldn’t even locate my bag, I don’t how come they can’t locate a bag. Never flying tem again nor recommended. Such a nightmare.

route: Perth to Langkawi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Worst service ever and when you pay for flexi you get told you can’t upgrade later like it promises you can. If they delay or cancel your flight they take no responsibility their response was “that’s what you get insurance for”. Lucky for us we always buy insurance but come on, take some accountability! When we call customer service because no one can seem to help us at the airports about upgrading on the way back, you get put on hold for extended periods of time, so long that it eventually just drops your call while you’re waiting. Told by the manager themselves that they would call back in 5mins and no call over 1.5 hours later. After 5 hours of going back and forth and no manager returning our calls, we are told we can only upgrade the entire trip and not parts of it. Extremely frustrating to hear when you were told the complete opposite on the way to our destination. Phone then drops out again and you can’t upgrade on their website. Ended up just cancelling our flights and booking flights with another company we were that disgusted with their lack of appropriate service. Will never book with them again.

This is the first time I had a very bad experience with Malaysia airlines, I have bought a round-trip ticket to fly back Malaysia from Melbourne. However, I have made some changes few days before with the call center to postponed my return flight back to Melbourne as I wish to extend my stay in Malaysia. On the 25 Nov which I should fly with MH128 at 00.30am from Melbourne to Malaysia and found out there is an issue with my ticket when I checked in at the counter as there is no ticket number can be found in the system. The lady at the counter  told me that she couldn’t fix it as there is no ticket found and she suspect they must have messed up my ticket when they changed my return flight so she made me to call the Malaysia airlines on the spot to help to fix the problem. Finally get through the call centre after 15 minutes, it is very disappointing that they fixed it but putting me into the wrong flight - MH148 (which is the flight that fly off the next day) and she hung me up after that without calling me back to fix the error. I was lucky enough as there are 2 counter ladies tried what they can to help me out. I’m not too sure how they fix it but at least now they can find my name in the system so they could get an approval from the back station to do something for me so that I could fly with MH128 which is the flight I initially booked. I am making this complain to hope Malaysia airlines is aware so they can improve in the future.

Check in was a completely automated process in Perth. The flight was delayed by an hour and we did receive an email to warn us about this. The departure time was 0220 but the aircraft was finally airborne at 0400! The boarding process was not well managed and there was little enforcement of hand luggage. There were a lot or travellers who were heading to India and Nepal and they seemed to have lots of hand luggage and there was insufficient space in the overhead bins. This is where things get weird. Once airborne at 4am, you would think they would give everyone a drink and a bag of peanuts and then turn off the lights and let the passengers sleep and then serve them breakfast before landing. But no, we were served a hot meal of either chicken curry or beef stew! By the time the meal service was over, there was about only 3.5 hours of flying time left to rest! The cabin crew were not warm and we had a surly male flight attendant serving us. The IFE was limited and not all seats had headphones or blankets so a lot of people were asking for them. All in all, MH could do a lot better. They make a big deal of Malaysian hospitality on the plane but that was probably reserved for the premium class up front.

Embarking on the usual route from Kuching to Kuala Lumpur with Malaysia Airlines proved to be a standard yet reliable experience. The boarding was well-organized, and the cabin crew welcomed passengers with the characteristic warmth that Malaysia Airlines is known for. Seating arrangements were comfortable, providing a decent level of comfort for the relatively short flight. The in-flight entertainment options were varied (but I don't use inflight entertainment because I have downloaded movie content on my mobile phone). The in-flight dining experience, while not groundbreaking, met the expectations of a standard domestic flight. Being someone with dietary restrictions, I was pleasantly surprised by the superb gluten-free dining experience. The flight itself proceeded without any significant issues, and the punctuality of arrival in Kuala Lumpur allowed for a smooth transition for passengers connecting to their next destinations. For those seeking a straightforward journey with reliable service, Malaysia Airlines continues to be a solid choice for domestic travel within Malaysia.

My recent trip from a usual departure point to Kuching with Malaysia Airlines was marked by a commendable standard of service, making it a pleasant and uneventful journey. Check-in procedures were smooth, with attentive ground staff ensuring a hassle-free start to the travel experience. The boarding process was well-organized, and the cabin crew welcomed passengers with the warmth and professionalism that Malaysia Airlines is known for. Seating arrangements were comfortable, providing adequate legroom for the duration of the flight. The in-flight entertainment system offered a variety of options to suit diverse tastes, making the journey enjoyable for those who sought entertainment during the flight. The in-flight dining experience was modest, with a menu that featured local flavors. While not necessarily groundbreaking, the meals were satisfying, and the cabin crew ensured that passengers were well taken care of throughout the flight. The flight itself proceeded with significant delays, and the arrival in Kuching was a bit late. Overall, my experience on the usual route to Kuching with Malaysia Airlines was standard in the best sense of the word. The airline's commitment to providing a reliable and comfortable travel experience was evident, making it a solid choice for those looking for a straightforward journey without any major surprises.

My recent flight with Malaysia Airlines was nothing short of exceptional, with standout features in the realms of gastronomy and service provided by the impeccable cabin crew. I recently had the pleasure of flying with Malaysia Airlines post the reported catering issue, and I'm thrilled to announce that the airline has made a triumphant comeback in the realm of in-flight dining. The previous concerns seem to be a distant memory as the culinary experience on my recent flight was nothing short of spectacular. Malaysia Airlines has not only resolved the catering issue but has taken this opportunity to elevate its food offerings to new heights. From the moment I made my dietary request, the attention to detail was evident. Malaysia Airlines went above and beyond to ensure that my gluten-free meal was not only safe but also delicious. The cabin crew played a crucial role in making the experience seamless. Their understanding of dietary restrictions and willingness to accommodate special requests was commendable. It was clear that Malaysia Airlines places a high priority on passenger comfort and satisfaction, regardless of dietary preferences. Choosing not to utilize the in-flight entertainment and Wi-Fi, I experienced a journey marked by tranquility and the simple joy of being unplugged. Overall satisfied.

route: Sydney to London via Kuala Lumpur
review: A lot of negativity about MH on here, but we had good communication, service, food and flights/baggage arrived when they were supposed to at a good price point. Airlines have changed post covid and measure your expectations. The only downsides we experienced were longish layovers at KUL which are exhausting on the westbound SYD-LHR. My partner is partially sighted and MH were very courteous and helped us a lot. Sure the AVOD selection is rather basic and the A333s are old but the service, legroom, food, and overall experience bar the entertainment were on a par with SQ who I flew with last year and vastly superior to LH on the same trip. The airline seems to be trying to address previous problems effectively - recommend booking lounge access if you are westbound thru KUL if you can

Disappointed with MAS for using narrow body aircraft for long haul. Passenger had to squeeze in to their seat or get off to the toilet. Worst if the passenger in front pull back their seats. The space become so small and very uncomfortable.

Changed people's flight from MORNING to NIGHT! This has wasted our time and delayed the schedule. Requested to change flights but asked for extra pay. The customer service helped to reply with another flight which was non direct flight, we already accepted it but the next day the airline did not allow us to change from a direct to a non-direct flight. This is the last time we buy a ticket from Malaysia Airlines

Cabin crew service was great, but the inflight meal for business class was very disappointing the food presentation was ugly and worst part was the food was the  same as economy class. Further more a hours flight and no alcohol served.

Short hop on Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. The flight was good and since it was a short 40 min hop, F&B was water or orange juice and their signature salted peanuts. Crew were attentive and are commendable for their detailed thought into senior citizens on the flight who requested for hot water. Love their short haul crew.

route: Adelaide to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: From now I won't be using MH after my upcoming trip. When I land in KL on the 19th of Oct, what was a 2hr layover, has become a 17 hour layover. No compensation, no offer to put us up in a hotel or into another carrier, the customer, must wear this. Why? Engineering issues. 2 weeks out. Reality not enough seats sold. Trying to communicate with the transit hotel is pure pain.  So no flight leaves KUL for Bangkok after 16:00, until 09:00 the next day. So the wife and i forced to stay in the transit hotel at a stupid cost, because MH put it's budget before customer service. No one in their right mind would choose this lay over, unless the ticket was dirt cheap. When i spoke to MAmH contact centre, they were fine with the 2 week notice, as they deemed it not short notice. My response. Tickets bought 5 months ago on an international route, I'd define it as short notice. When you knowingly turn a 2 hour layover into 17hours with not a care in the World.

Seat spacing (leg room) the biggest issue for us. We fly a lot and recommend avoiding Malaysia Airlines at all costs. They have reduced the seat spacing to the ridiculous and more importantly they do not care. Seeing row after row of passengers sitting bolt upright (with seats supposedly reclined) trying to watch a movie on a screen which is just inches from their face beggars belief. One needing the restroom requires all in the row leaving their seats (with a high degree of difficulty, yanking on the seats in front) to let others out. Mealtimes a joke, as even seeing the tray is difficult with it being so close to your body let alone getting the food up to your mouth. In addition MH feel justified seating couples apart even when they booked together and more to the point, are  dismissive of any pleas to sit together. We had two 11 hr flights putting up with these conditions. Arrogance and indifference are the norm with this lot.

I wouldn't recommend this airline unless you have no other option. The flight started with a late departure, over an hour late with no real reason. During the flight free wifi cards were handed out. However, the WiFi was not working. bit of a waste of paper. The refresher towels were handed out and all were cold. The meals were terrible. Warm Yogurt, overcooked beef, soggy salad.  The seat USB points do not work. The Headset jacks dropped in and out.

route: Sydney to Dhaka via Kuala Lumpur
review: Malaysia Airlines has been our go to airlines for the past 10 years because the price was reasonable, the meals were great and the service was good over all. However, I am seeing the decline of the service over time and the last experience is like a nail in the coffin. The experience started with poor instructions in the boarding gate, people were confused and cluttered around the entrance. 30 minutes of late boarding was followed by another 30 minutes stranding in the runway. Everyone was seated and with ready to go by had no idea why the plane was not moving. After 30 minutes the pilot realised he needs to explain and then gave an announcement about the take off queue. Once the flight took off, they served 3 small pieces of vegetable balls as dinner. Thankfully the breakfast served in the morning was standard (scrambled eggs, butter, bread, fruit, etc). We landed safely in KL for stop over. The flight from KL was delayed because Malaysian airlines could not solve an issue they were having with their catering and had to delay an international flight by an hour. Boarding was no better than before, they were calling in groups by i figured whoever by passed the queue, they allowed them to onboard first. This time meal was chickpeas in lentil, white rice and one piece of carrot as lunch.  Given the airlines are charging 50% more than pre-covid, it is expected that they at least maintain similar decent standard. But the overall experience of my flight was very sub standard to say the least.

I am writing to express my utmost disappointment in the quality of service provided by Malaysia Airlines, an airline I have frequently patronized in the past. Regrettably, my recent experiences have led me to conclude that the airline has regressed significantly, to the extent that I consider it the worst airline I have ever traveled with. It has come to my attention that Malaysia Airlines' website and mobile app consistently display inaccurate pricing for various services. This not only raises questions about the airline's transparency but also creates an environment that appears designed to deceive customers and extract more funds from them. My attempts to seek clarification and resolution through email channels have proven futile, as I have received no response from the customer service team. In contrast to the silent email responses, my interactions with the call center agents have been far from satisfactory. The unprofessional and unhelpful conduct exhibited during these exchanges only compounds my concerns. My suspicion that the airline is deliberately misleading customers deepens as I observe irregularities in the pricing display of additional services. The functionality of the website is fraught with issues, further exacerbating the overall negative experience. Navigating the site has become an arduous task, detracting from the convenience one should expect. The quality of in-flight meal replacements has reached a level I can only describe as abysmal. The deterioration in food quality reflects poorly on the airline and its commitment to passenger satisfaction.  My experience with flight attendants has left much to be desired, particularly in relation to the distribution of basic amenities such as blankets and headphones. Such lapses in service standards are inexcusable.

Astonishing lack of corporate customer care. My business flight had been booked for weeks and I had meetings organised soon after arriving. But on the way to the airport I received a curt text informing me that the flight was cancelled and if been placed in a flight 4 hours later! Such arrogance. I run a massively customer facing organisation and under no circumstances would we casually disrupt our customers' plans. No explanation, chaos at the airport, ground staff heroically managing the mass of rescheduled travellers. Does Malaysian Air imagine that they have a monopoly on this route? If so, they're about to receive an awakening. No further business from me, my company or hopefully, none of my friends.

route: Melbourne to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: I bought a flexible fare and requested refund over three months ago. I have been calling them every 2 weeks and still no refund. I also have no evidence about cancellation or no correspondences from the airlines, The Malaysian Airlines is ruining Malaysia's image - It is disgrace.

route: Lawas to Kota Kinabalu via Kuala Lumpur
review: I recently had the unfortunate experience of flying with Malaysia Airlines, and I must say that it was one of the most disappointing travel experiences I've ever had. I am a person who is not too concerned about the services but this experience needs to be taken into account by the management. This review focuses on my Kota Kinabalu (BKI) to Kuala Lumpur (KUL) route. Punctuality: Retime for 1 hour later, but take-off about 1 hour and a half. The good side of this, they kept e-mailed me on the retime earlier as I needed to make sure my first leg flight was on time and plan my transfer from 1st flight to this flight (including check-in as I was not allowed to check-in online) Boarding Experience: As the boarding gate is shared with another airline, the boarding queue seems unorganized as the space for queuing is small. Basic Comfort: While the seating and cabin amenities are modest, they are adequate for shorter flights. The seating is functional, and there's sufficient legroom for a comfortable journey. Old aircraft but it was okay for me. In-Flight Service: Normal in-flight experience. Snacks and beverages (hot meals) are available but understand the situation faced by this airline. Cabin crew: Normally I give 5 stars to the crew, but on this flight their performance was modest.

route: Kuala Lumpur to Lawas via Miri
review: The cabin of the aircraft was clean and well-maintained. The seats were comfortable enough for the duration of the flight, but legroom was modest I found it difficult to stretch my legs. There is no in-flight entertainment system but I can connect to Wifi to access the IFE. The complimentary meal was packed with biscuits, cakes, cookies, and water (due to supplier change), but it was okay as I already brought my own food. Overall satisfied but need some upgrades in so many ways.

Not professional. 3/4 of check in counters are empty. Only one person for baggage and one person for check in. This is ridiculous. The lines are branching outside of the check in lines because it’s so slow. I haven’t moved in 20 minutes. I rarely fly with this airline and I’ll make sure I never do so every again.

route: Medan to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: On the 10th Sept 2023, I and my wife is going to return to Australia from Medan, Indonesia. We check in Kualanamu Airport, producing our flight booking reference. Initially I and my wife are on the same booking number, but due to death in our family my wife have to travel a couple days earlier to be able to attend the funeral. So my wife have to pay penalty for change of date of travel to Indonesia and she was given another booking reference. During the change of date the Malaysian Customer support assured us that our date of return to Australia from Medan will be the same / no change, that is on the 10th Sept 2023. But when we check in to the Malaysian Airlines counter, the staff told us that they can not find our name in their system, therefore they will not check us in. We protest and produce the print out (hard copy) of our booking 6JMMSH and 6Q3LSE. They took the copy and check their system again. And again they told us that they can not find our names and bookings in their system. I cannot believe this. Here we are, producing the hardcopy of our bookings, and payments and they said they can not find our in their system. We told them to look hard and find out from their bosses. But the manager said they are sorry they can not help us. Then they refer us to their higher bosses in Kualanamu Airport, and this boss said the same thing that they can not help us. They told us to ring Malaysian Airlines.  In the airport we do not have the Malaysian Airlines number, we do not have the contact number, and we should not have to do all of this, the Malaysian check in staff should find out all about this. I tried to ring my daughter in Australia by whatsapp and managed to find her. I told her the problem and send her the bookings reference number of our flight. She looks into the Malaysian Airlines website and put in our flight number. And our names are there to fly on that date which is the 10th Sept 2023. She sent this information to our phones and we showed this to Malaysian Airlines staff. Yet they still said that they cannot find our names in the system. We are so mad and disappointed. The thinking that we may missed the flight is frightened us. Yet the Malaysian Airlines staff at Kualanamu keep saying they can not help us. We ring our daughter in Australia asking her to ring Malaysian Airlines Customer Support. In the mean time we are the only two persons left in the counter, because everyone else already boarding. After a long wait finally my daughter get in contact with the Customer support which said they will look in the system and investigate. Another long wait, and the plane take off time is getting closer. We are so depressed and thinking about the potential losses of money if we can not get the flight. My daughter from Australia tried to speak the Malaysian Airlines staff to explain what they find out from Malaysian airlines website, but the staff said they cannot hear my daughter. After a while, while we are thinking about what to do with this situation, the Malaysian Airlines staff told us that now they find our names in the system. And that now we can check in.

route: Bangkok Suvarnabhumi to Penang via Kuala Lumpur KLIA
review: Check in was fast, and on both legs boarding by row number was enforced and therefore efficient and fast. The seat on the international leg was comfortable, and a tasty hot meal and soft beverages were served. The flight operated on time. On the domestic leg seats were a bit tighter. Nuts and water were served. While boarding was orderly, people were allowed to bring on huge amounts of carry-on baggage, resulting in bewildered passengers struggling through the cabin looking for storage. Transit at KLIA was a grim experience, due to long and poorly organised immigration queues with a hour's waiting, and a dark domestic departures area with low ceilings and very few coffee and food outlets. There is free wifi, though. Apart from having to transit through KLIA, the journey with Malaysian was a good experience.

I had no choice but to fly Malaysia Airlines because they partnered with Qatar Airways. My flight was the last leg from Doha to Kuala Lumpur, almost an 8-hour flight. The plane was old, my seat couldn't recline, and the bathroom was held together with duct tape. But at least the plane didn't rattle like the flight that I was also forced to take - with Malaysian Airlines last year. The flight attendants that attended our section lack finesse and class, in my opinion. First, boarding was a surprise for me as they announced business class and families with children and then after that everyone else instead of rows or zones. Chaos ensued as the crowd rushed and there was only one lady checking the boarding passes! Upon boarding, a flight attendant in the back was yelling out instructions to her colleague in the front. And unfortunately it happened right when I was squeezing past her and my ear was near her mouth. Then I witnessed another one eagerly, over-politely showing a young able-bodied Caucasian couple to their seats. They clearly did not need her assistance as they were already loading their cabin baggage in the overhead compartment. This was not a real problem except that it's a pet peeve of mine when white people are treated differently and her tone of voice changes when speaking to people like myself. I don't know whether it was my luck I got a crass crew but while serving meals, they announced the options to one row and to the next row they only asked loudly "And you guys? What do you want?" After serving refreshments they were collecting rubbish and they did this by walking down the aisle yelling "CUPS! RUBBISH! CUPS! CUPS! RUBBISH!" And before landing they walked down the aisle in the same fashion, this time yelling "SEATBELTS! SEATBELTS! SEATBELTS!" I almost burst out laughing because of the irony when near the end of the flight there was a totally pointless video that interrupted my movie with a punchline "THIS is Malaysian hospitality." I was also a bit embarrassed because I am Malaysian and the level of hospitality of the crew was below par compared to the other airlines I've flown with, including budget airlines.

I am a Malaysia Airlines Enrich member and used to travel a lot once I was an Enrich Gold member, due to COVID and no connection and reduced flights, could not travel with Malaysia Airlines as a result they dropped my status to basic blue members. I recently flew with Malaysia Airlines to KL and it is now chasing the budget Airasia model to sustain. Right from the time you search on their flight pricing, they offer bait flights with 7 KG handbag and then you need to add various services with additional prices such as check bag of 20 kg or 30 Kg options, then seat selection, if you want to sit in front of cabin additional fees etc. I am surprised by how a low type mentality people at the top end thinks and try to compete with budget airline and their pricing instead of leading the pack with a good level of service. Checking at Sydney there are only 3 open counters one dedicated to business class so economy passengers have to wait in queue for more than an hour to get checked because they don't have people to check them in. Flights get delayed as passengers still checked in just 40 minutes before departure. Inflight music is so uncomfortable to the ears that you wish there was no music. They announced by email that there was a change in Catering service, so we should expect a change in food expectations, but did not expect that they serve meals in paper boxes instead of plastic trays, placing bread rolls and butter on table which every one knows that how unhygienic that table is. The quantity of food has reduced to just a few morsels and items like salad and decent dessert are missing replaced with 2-inch x 2-inch slices of banana bread. After the meal service and the boxes were taken away they served us wine and drinks and thereafter another person came and dropped peanut bags. When questioning staff why you serve meal first, wine thereafter and peanut last. I have been told this is how standard or Practice is advised by the management. Apparently, it looks like someone is running the airline and inflight experience by the people who do not have any experience or knowledge. On the whole 8-hour flight, the inflight cabin was lit and lights on as a result we could not get sleep. Aircraft are run down, toilets are wet, and smelly, and paper rolls are missing in the toilet. For the inflight crew on the way to KL, I had a great crew with smiles on their face, but when returning from KL the crew were grumpy and had no initiative to serve. I wonder if this attitude of airlines is going to continue for another year or two then certainly this is the major downfall of MH from high on a pedestal to the floor in the long run.

route: Auckland to Mumbai via Kuala Lumpur
review: The flight from Auckland was late by 2 hours. The toilets were dirty. Food below standard. The flight from Mumbai to Kuala Lumpur was late by 2.5 hours, the aircraft has old display screen which were not working.  Now flying back to Auckland via kl. Plane is late by 2 hours. I hope the toilets will be clean but the food which was served was below standard.

route: Delhi to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: First and likely last time flying Malaysia Airlines. Albeit expectations weren’t that high, I was looking forward to flying Malaysia Airlines for the first time. Check-in at Delhi airport opened a little over 4 hours before scheduled departure time which meant that I could clear customs and security at Delhi airport fairly quickly. Traveling in business class, I received a ticket to the newly opened Encore Prive lounge at Delhi airport. Food and drinks were excellent. Boarding was chaotic but quick.  After boarding, we waited for an additional 30 minutes for 4 missing passengers. Eventually doors closed, the aircraft was pushed back and we  stood on a taxiway for another 45 minutes. During all this time, MH’s boarding music blared out of the PA system. I don’t mind delays but having that jingle play for 2 hours straight at 11:30 was just torture. The stuff of nightmares, however, was the catering on the second leg. Apparently Malaysia Airlines had a falling out with their catering partner, which means that they currently don’t have a catering partner. Instead of a proper meal, you get a tuna roll and prepackaged backed goods. It was by far the worst meal I have ever seen in a plane. To add insult to injury, many of MH’s flights (including my second leg) are delayed … owing to catering problems. Yes, if you fire your caterer, then you can no longer use their trucks so loading disgusting tuna rolls onto your aircrafts takes more time. The crew was very friendly - no beverages other than water, orange juice and apple juice - no alternative option to tuna roll - infotainment aged and not that many option. No wifi, the seat on A330-300 was good for a short to medium range flight. Not the best out there but good to get a little sleep.

Good flight. Very good cabin crew service even though this was a night flight. Seat was ok. Entertainment wasn't very good, mediocre films and no games. Toilets clean and well serviced during the flight. Food was plentiful and tasty and lots of refreshments offered between services.

I travelled on Malaysia Airlines as part of a code share flight booked through Qatar Airways through Doha. The flight itself was lovely, great crew and great food and excellent service. The whole thing for me fell apart due to the excessive delay of frequent flyer mile award to my BA account. Qatar awarded the points within 20 hours and on day 4 I saw that Malaysia had still not awarded the points so I thought I’d contact Malaysia Airlines via Twitter. Such rudeness and avoidance of the issue in answering the question on how long it takes Malaysia Airlines to award flight miles. They just would not answer the question, which in itself is a simple question and would set my expectation. Based on this I’ve cancelled all my forthcoming flights on Malaysia Airlines and will choose a more understanding carrier.

I press the call button to ask for a blanket. But there was no respond. Its about 10 minutes. Then the staff who was distributing food beside me came, but he didn't listen to me. Then I asked again to other staff beside me for a blanket. She asked me to wait because she was distributing food.  10 minutes passed. I’ve got the flu and shivering. About 20 minutes later, my husband help me by pressing the call button. The same staff approached my husband asking to bring 2 blankets. Not long after, the staff came but only brought 1 blanket. He said "only one".

route: London to Kota Kinabalu via Kuala Lumpur
review: I am a first time Business Class traveller, and treated myself as the price seemed reasonable for the extra perks provided. I was not disappointed. Worth doing research and I booked 3A and opted to use the Qatar Business Lounge opposite Gate 6 in T4-LHR. Will review separately, but a good start to trip. Wasn't too clear which was the Business Class queue at Gate 6 but once found, boarding was prompt. A welcome drink (juice or water) and hot towel offered on the ground. Once airborne, champagne, a menu and amenity kit were given out but I felt it strange no wine or drinks menu. Service was very good, all very prompt, my G&T topped up without asking, and food quickly followed. Satay was fab, the beef very good, and black forest dessert exemplary. Not alot of cabin presence in between services. There were snacks available on request according to the menu and I grabbed an ice cream pot at one point. Second service offered about 3 hours out of KL. I found the seat very comfortable and easy to use. Nice and private, and i loved the massage function. Entertainment was not as good as other airlines, no games, no live TV, and movies weren't great. Other than that, a very comfortable and enjoyable flight.

On my return flight from Denpasar , entering the boarding area, i was informed it qas mandatory to have a printed boarding pass. I showed them my online check in and e-boarding pass and insisted to board, since it was time, they said "for Malasya Airlines must go to counter and print" and pointed me to the wrong direction. When i got there, service was slow and after a couple inquirees she told me i could not board the flight due to the time. Their customer service is only via phonecall. No one at the airport could help and when i call, they hang up. Absurd service for our digital times! Do not recommend. Flight and food are nice, but no support whatso ever. Could be flying low cost and would be better attended to.

route: Colombo to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: The seats didn't even have enough leg room for my wife and 14 year old daughter. This is unacceptable, where you squeeze in extra seats for profit so over more than a 9 hour flight we can't be comfortable. We won't fly Malaysia Airlines again. I will also provide independent reviews outside of this survey recommending people don't fly with you. It was terrible. MH0133 Saturday 22 July. Seat 46D, 46E and 46F. Was it just these seats? My wife and 14 year old child can't fit in your plane due to legroom. They took out the magazines from the seat pocket ahead because their knees were hitting it. Is it just these seats?

route: Osaka to Perth via Kuala Lumpur
review: I’m late writing this review since for the last 4 months I have been attempting to progress a complaint with customer services. Despite having contacted them on repeated occasions they have totally ignored my correspondence. I flew via KL just two weeks ago and even discussed my case with a representative of Malaysia Airlines at the airport in KL. She was fully aware of the abysmal record of customer services in dealing with complaints and acknowledged that most complaints are simply ignored. The appalling way in which Malaysian airlines treats its customers is clear testimony to the fact we need stronger consumer protection laws in Australia that match what the Europeans do. In terms of the substance of my complaint it was multifaceted but basically revolved around the following. Initial cancellation of my flight from KL to Tokyo Subsequent six hour delay in the flight from KL to Tokyo resulting in a 4 am arrival and no public transport available. Cancellation of my flight from Osaka to KL and a delay of 24 hours incurring hotel expenses. Preferred extra legroom seats (which I had paid for) not being carried forward when flights are cancelled. In short serious matters which had a direct financial impact but which Malaysia Airlines simply choose to ignore. Totally appalled by their lack of interest or care despite all the proclamations of the importance they attach to customer service. I recently experienced a cancelled flight on British Airways. Compensation promptly paid to cover extra expenses. Experience could not have been more different despite the fact that both these airlines are part of the same (one world) alliance

A very bad trip flight from Singapore to Kuala Lumpur was delayed one hour they lost my baggage at connection in KL as i was going to Bangkok. The food was disgusting and the staff was not nice. The entertainment was horrible and sound awful. As a gold member of Finnair, i wanted to earn points on the one world alliance with MH. It was a big mistake. This company is really bad ... how can MH stay under Oneworld alliance ?

Malaysian airlines provided me and my family an excellent 5 star service to Langkawi, with extremely fair prices and a very smooth flying experience. I would like to specifically point out the check-in desks who made us feel at home and went out of their way to make an adjustment so that we could sit on the same aisle. We felt welcomed and at home with the airline. Thank you very much!
