I got given ‘food’ and ‘accommodation’ at the airport which was disgusting and again as a vegetarian the only thing I could eat was Lukewarm pasta and tomato sauce, which was gross. When I asked to use the phone at the Malaysia airlines desk to make some international calls I was denied by the airline and had to use another passengers. How was my family to know I was safe when I didn’t arrive at Perth airport when I intended too. I called up this afternoon asking for some compensation and got told because I had redeemed my alternative flights given to me, I was entitled to none.  I shall never be flying with this airline again and the ‘cheap’ price is not even worth it. My experience with this airline was worse than my experience with long haul budget airlines.

My friend and I traveled from Dublin to London Heathrow with on 26/6/22 and London Heathrow to Kuala Lumpur and Kuala Lumpur to Bali Denpasar. When we arrived into Bali to our horror our luggage was not at the airport and we reported this immediately to a member of staff. We were informed by a staff member that we would receive an email with a reference number regarding our case but we have not received this or any further correspondence from any of your team. I am absolutely horrified with the lack of service and communication from your company. We are on our holidays with no luggage! When I return from this trip I will never fly with your company again. We have only received empty promises and zero communication when we need it most!  A very disappointed passenger.

I booked a flight with MH from KL to Penang on 28 June. Flight number MH1614 departing at 10:40am. I tried but was not able to check in online. I arrived at the airport and joined the queue for check in counter at 9:30am. There were only 2 passengers in front of me. The ground staff was super slow and was busy chit chatting to passengers. It was 9:55am when I got to the counter. First, the ground staff claimed not to be able to find my ticket. Once she found it, she told me I could not check in because it was too late even though the flight was not taking off until 10:40am. I was directed to the ticket counter and I was was told I needed to buy a new ticket. I ended buying a new ticket with AirAsia but had to wait at the airport till 6:20pm for the new flight. I went back to lodge a complaint with the ground staff manager. The man showed up and was defensive and dismissive the entire time. Not making eye contact. He asserted I joined the wrong queue for special needs even though there was no signage to inform passengers. Basically he hinted that I was my fault for not being able to check in. I told him the line I was in only have 2 passengers ahead of me while the so called normal line had 10 passengers. Common sense told me my line should be faster. He claimed the other line with 10 passengers definitely should be faster. He also told me I had no idea what the ground staff was saying to the other passengers ahead of me and I needed to appreciate the condition they worked under. I informed him that I would lodge an online complaint but given my experience thus far I do not expect any satisfactory response from the airlines. The ground staff manager actually told me “you do whatever you want”!

route: Auckland to London via Kuala Lumpur
review: We left NZ 2 hrs and 30mins late, which made me miss my connecting flight to London. They lost my luggage and the plane was ancient and packed. They tried to put me in a hotel for 2 nights when I had a tight schedule and I had to fight to get on another airline. They lied saying there was no other planes to London but I found one available and pushed them into booking me with the other airline.  Will never fly with them again.

One of my most memorable flights during & immediately post pandemic crisis. Check-in at Heathrow T2 was efficiently managed and I was worried that my 2 suitcases might join luggage carpet at end of my journey. Mine was checked through to destination intact. Inflight services - meals were satisfactory especially after I've pre ordered my meal (non gluten), even have had a decent Aussie White to go with it. Inflight entertaiment was adequate & up to date. Best of all, I have had very decent fellow fliers sitting around me.

Seats 29A and 29C. Ground service pathetic even though web check in was done earlier. Waited for more than 1 hour twenty minutes for counter check in  Food and drinks was a disaster.  Coffee and tea not served, excuse was seat belt sign was on. No  turbulence experienced during the flight. Soft drinks minimal and no alcohol. Customer service non existent. Aircraft was an A330-300 which was ancient as could be seen from the entertainment format and the yellowing plastic on the control 6. Seats were archaic, Head rest kept sliding down. Arm rest could not be stay upright and fell immediately .

Joke of an airline. Airline made us board, and shortly after boarding, told us that the plane has technical issues and deboarded the whole plane. The airline had the whole pre departure to check. Deliberately retimed flight to 1 hour 55 minutes later, to avoid the meal and convenience compensation for delays over 2 hours. The final delay, 2 hours 15 minutes, but no convenience is offered. This is worse than budget airlines.

Worst airline ever. They lost my baggage. No reply, no update, no compensation. They just don't care! Already called their agent in HK, submitted a report, sent multiple e-mails. Nothing. Absolutely no action. What else am I supposed to do? This was my first time with this airline, never again!

My family and I are regular visitors to Malaysia. My wife and I have just been to Sabah for 2 weeks, arriving on the 2nd April, on a trip postponed from March 2021 due to covid. We arrived in Malaysia (Kuala Lumpur) at c 11pm on the 1st April from the UK (on a KLM flight) and satisfied all entry requirements - we were fully vaccinated (inc booster), had taken a PCR test within 48 hrs of departing which was negative and had the MySejahtera app on our phones (with all of this information on it). We had a flight booked to Kota Kinabulu on Malaysian Airlines at 09:15 on Saturday 2nd April and had intended to take our rapid antigen test on arrival at KK airport, given this would have been within 24hrs of arriving in Malaysia - we had been informed this was OK to do by the immigration staff on arrival at KL, given we were in transit to Sabah. When we arrived to check in for our flight, Malaysian Airlines would not allow us to check in, even though we had cleared immigration in KL. They made us take a new PCR test before they would allow us to board the flight, which meant we missed our original flight and had to re-book on another flight. We were informed by the Dr2U service where we had our PCR test that we didn't need a PCR test, but we had no alternative but to do so, because Malaysian Airlines would not less us board until we had taken a test, and the results were negative. As a result of the delays we missed our first day's activities in Sabah and had to spend 700 MR on PCR tests we did not need to take. everyone we spoke in Malaysia (excepting Malaysian Airlines staff) said we did not need to get the PCR test, we were not international travellers, but Malaysian Airlines refuse to acknowledge their mistake.

I booked a flight with Malaysia Airlines from Singapore to Penang. I received an email letting me know my flight to Penang was cancel and force me to change the flight to 2 days later. I called up the customer service and they do not allow refund at all. The only option they provided me is to transit in KL. So the flight time from 1.5 hours to 6 hours is the best they can do. I wanted a full refund and was rejected mentioned that the ticket I bought is non-refundable. It is ridiculous that the airline just cancel a booked flight, force customer to take transit and do not compensate anything on my time lose nor do not allow refund at all. This is the most ridiculous customer service ever! If they are not flying, they should not published the flight and allow customer to purchase. This is obviously a ripped-off and leave customer with no choice. They obviously do not care about the inconvenient they caused to their customer. I regretted booking a flight with this airline and I won't do so again.

I booked a flight with Malaysia Airlines from Brisbane to Kuala Lumpur. I received an email letting me know my flight was rescheduled for Two days later. Even for a two-hour delay, most airlines compensate customers. Because I had a connection flight and two days later did not work for me, I asked the airline to cancel my flight. I was told that I should pay $200 as a penalty for canceling my flight. I again asked them to change the departure city from Sydney to that of my original booking. I would pay for a flight to Sydney from my pocket since most airlines provide this option. Then they told me that I needed to pay $700 and they would do it for me!  In response to my request to cancel this flight and give me a voucher for my next trip, the staff replied they don't have this policy. Why should I pay for their mistakes? I had to pay $200/per person to cancel my flight. I regret booking a flight with this airline and I won't do so again.

This airline are dreadful, I will never use them again. I paid £200 to upgrade my seats and then all of a sudden they changed my plane on both outbound and return and I ended up losing my upgrade and no refund available, trying to contact them is very difficult as the customer service is so bad. I can understand changing my ticket and making me wait at the airport for 27 hours but no refund is really bad. I also tried to save my air miles with their rubbish app but all I get is a message saying they will contact me but two weeks later no news just loads of rubbish emails trying to sell me more things. I’d advise everyone to choose another airline.

MAS changed my flight schedule multiple times and the last change resulted in a connecting flight KUL to SIN with departure time scheduled for the next day (rescheduled from May 8 to May 9). Ground staff at KUL MAS transfer counter advised that MAS do not provide compensation for hotel stay nor transportation cost to hotel, and I'm expected to contact my own insurance agency for claims. While airlines reserve the rights to cancel and reschedule itineraries, I find MAS rescheduling insensitive and unreliable.

route: Kathmandu to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Very disappointed this time. I asked for a glass of water for my 5 years old kid 3/4 times to all the crew but none of them got it.  One of the team member said we will be starting our trolley round soon. We got water after 1 hour and 30minutes.  One of team member said we are very busy can you wait. Flight MH0149 Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne on 7th May 2022.

Probably one of the best experience I ever had with Malaysia Airlines. Flew out LHR-KUL on 1st May in business cabin. Priority check- in was superb at LHR, whole process took less than 5 mins - boarding pass and bag tags printed, documents checked, i.e. passport, MySejahtera app, status of vaccination. Boarding was smooth, no queues at the jet bridge (separate jet bridge for premium passengers). Greeted by crew and guided to my seat. Welcome drinks was offer selection juices and water. About ten minutes later, second round of pre departure drinks was offer and this time is a champagne. Crew took our order for main course and dessert just before take off. Once airborne, crews come around with amenity kit and slippers. Soon after, water is served and drinks from the bar (soft and alcoholic drinks). Malaysia Airlines signature appetiser satay was excellent as always. I can’t fault catering from LHR as their meal was delicious. I had braised beef cheeks and chocolate cake. Two hours and 30 minutes before landing second meal is served and I had nasi lemak for my main. MH also provide dine at anytime for those who are hungry throughout the flight (from noodles, cold or hot sandwiches, light snacks and cheese board). IFE was pretty good, especially for new release movies and varieties of decent film and series, good selection of musics. Monitor touch screen very responsive. Sat on 8A which is the last row of the main section of the business class, I thought it going to be very noisy due to the galley and lavatory just right behind me but I have to say it hardly disturb me. What makes this flight so special was the cabin crews. Each and everyone of them have their own character and yet maintaining their professionalism. Crew members replica with MH slogan “Malaysian Hospitality begins with us”. So well done MH.

route: Melbourne to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: OK so this review, is actually for a flight that hasn't happened yet, however as there is no option for booking complaints here, I have posted this. So in 2020 like many, we had a holiday cancelled, Malaysians refund policy was different depending on which phone clown you got hold of, we decided given we had paid for it, and Malaysia Airlines being government owned we would hold the refund and take the credit. 2020 came and went 2021, and then in 2022 a new hope arrived, I contacted the agent at first to be told they couldn't find our booking, nor the advance seat selections we paid for, few phone calls later they found them, we they were told that the ticket had been changed to an open ticket not a credit, so we couldn't actually use the money we paid, but rather they would book us onto the leg we used, now on initial thought it wasn't a terrible idea, however the current price was far less than we paid, I questioned this and was hung up on , I called back waited the customary 35 mins and told that the ticket was to be booked exactly the same way originally booked, I asked given that it is some $300 cheaper now, can we be credited the difference, I was told no. I asked ok can we have additional luggage to the value, I was told not, I think found that given it was an open ticket rebooked - we couldn't have access to the upgrade option everyone else gets, phone call after phone call to these people has been fruitless, we will likely simply not show up, as the airfare isn't refundable, and frankly we will never fly with them again, the worst customer service and blatant stupid policy ever.

route: Melbourne to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: They cancelled my ticket on Dec 21. It's been more than 6 months since they mentioned that they have initiated my refund for the flight cancelled on Dec 2021. Been chasing them every week with no response.

route: London to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: We found that it was quite difficult to amend our flights as they changed the stopover from 2hours to 31 hours..didn't fancy hanging around that long. It took my partner 3hours to change it back to 2hours using the website. We tried ringing but gave up. However that was the only problem. Flight from London was on-time. Staff were super friendly and the meals served were just fine. Arrived at KUL ahead of time and the transfer was seamless. The airplane to Melbourne was quite old but clean and functional. I was satisfied with food selections. I'm glad we remained with Malaysia as we were thinking of Qantas however judging how far Qantas has slipped failing to transport economy baggage on London flights etc we were glad to stick with Malaysia Airlines.

route: Kathmandu to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: I will never fly with Malaysia Airlines again. When was Travelling to Kathmandu from KL after arriving from Melbourne.  There was no blankets or pillow in the economy class whereas there were in Business class. I have travelled through other airlines and this is not the case. It all depended on the fact that if you could speak for yourself and ask for one in English otherwise you are just sitting there in cold.  Whilst returning, again no blankets, rude staff and my flight was delayed by more than an hour and my transit was for little over 2 hours, when I expressed my concern to the staff, they told me that once I land in KL ground staff will help and swiftly take us to our gate. As I expected no ground staff present at all, I had 45 mins till my flight took off, ran around to search for my gate in that big airport and finally made it 10 mins before they closed the gate. As I was resting in the flight, no attempt to wake me up for my food, they just left my food there.

route: Singapore to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Singapore to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. Never flying MAS ever again. Perhaps they’d like to let us know when they can fly instead of have us book, only to be cancelled/ rescheduled. I initially booked a flight from SG-KUL-MEL, naturally coordinating around the dates I’ve booked. They rescheduled the flight to a day earlier which was inconvenient but somewhat workable. However, I had to personally postpone my trip so I rebooked it for 2 weeks later. My initial flight from SG to KUL was 5.30 pm with a 3 hour+ layover before flying to MEL at 10.10 pm. At 2.30 pm on the day of the flight, they notified that it is to be rescheduled to 6.30 pm. Since it was the public holidays, I decided to go to the airport 3 hours before my flight anticipating a long queue. While checking in, I was notified that my flight was rescheduled to 7.55 pm. However, at 7.55 pm, it could be seen that the plane just landed and passengers were just departing. This meant a further delay before eventually taking off past 8.30 pm. I landed in KUL 20 mins before my flight to MEL and as a result, had to scramble and run to the next gate. I was fortunate enough to make it and when I was seated, was told we were delayed because 16 passengers on a flight from Mumbai connecting in KUL was also delayed. We eventually departed more than 30 mins past the scheduled time. Upon arriving, I was told that they can’t locate my bag and suspect that it’s still in KUL. Absolutely disappointing experience. MAS has always been a mediocre airline but I’ve always supported it because it was our local pride. However, given the recent complaints, I hope you eventually lose all your customers as you’ve failed to treat your paying customers with the same respect and love they’ve shown you. Separate from the timetable, the food was absolutely disappointing. We were not given a choice and the food was barely hot. I remember the days when the food would arrive piping hot. Breakfast was supposed to be ‘chicken pie’ but was actually cheap cold stale bread with some chicken bits on it. Absolutely disgusting for the price paid on this flight. I will never fly MAS again and can only hope they stop their cancellation scams.

route: Bangalore to Hanoi via Kuala Lumpur
review: I booked return flights with them for 9th May from Bangalore to Hanoi. There was two parts to the trip from Bangalore to Hanoi, first one Bangalore to Kuala Lumpur and next one Kuala Lumpur to Hanoi. They changed the second leg of the trip Kuala Lumpur to Hanoi to 8th May and left the first leg of the trip as such. They refused to fix it and didn't offer cash refund. They gave me options to change to a different day, but have to pay additional $275 to get that one. Such a scam. People should stay away from this airline.

route: Langkawi to Mumbai via Kuala Lumpur
review: The experience at Langkawi airport and attendants at the airport was absolutely fine and there were no issues even during the transit. But the flight attendants were very rude and their behavior was aggressive, they were not polite even to kids. While serving the food I requested water which was denied and the reason mentioned was that she is busy. I was not able to digest the reason provided. A parent asked the attendant if they can provide some paper and pen if it is available, the response provided was that you better bring that when you fly next time and do not ask us. She could have politely said they do not have additional paper and pen/pencil with them.

Check-in was great. Quick and effective with many counters finally opened in KLIA compared to my previous flight with them. Boarding was fine, nothing out of the ordinary (Although it's great to see more passengers aboard since the pandemic). Hygiene kit and headset was provided to every passengers. The hygiene kit can be obtained during boarding at the front galley (inside the kit is a face mask and an alcohol wipe), while headset was put on each seat, wrapped in plastic wrap. The seat was decent (considering its over 5 years old) and the headset was also decent (could be better). The IFE system was (as always) functional but less responsive. The entertainments were great, but the movie that I watched don't have many subtitles options (Only mandarin subtitles was displayed, but I can't read it). The in-flight meal was either Nasi Lemak or Chicken Noodles, I had both and I would say the Nasi Lemak is better (8/10) while the Chicken Noodle is mediocre (6/10). The only thing I got frustrated with are the cabin crews. I wanted to dispose my plastic water cup and salted peanut packet, so I waited for them to pass by. Guess what, they pass by twice and I called them and they refused to take it. What's wrong with taking the empty water cup? Luckily it was just a small water cup (I clipped it in the seat bag), otherwise my tray table would be open the whole flight.

The front row seats in Economy class was pain to my neck. I sat at seat C (next to the aisle), and the screen is not aligned with my seat. I had to move my head a little to the left to see the screen. I have a feeling the passenger next to me (Seat B) could even see my screen (because it is closer to the passenger in the middle seat). Luckily the remote is available, otherwise I would have had to elongate my arm to touch the screen, bothering my neighbor. The food was mediocre, my friend complained the fish doesn't taste good and the chicken curry I had was fine. Other than that, the whole flight was just fine but improvements is needed in many areas.

route: Delhi to Brisbane via Kuala Lumpur
review: Malaysia Airlines change travel itineraries, stretching layover time from 15hrs to 4 days and will not pay for any accommodation, meals. Customer care office is in Malaysia. Hold time before answer is 15minutes and call can get extended to 45min-60min. Customer care will not transfer call to supervisor. I was put on hold for 26 minutes & 24 minutes & they hanged up to provide customer experience feedback.

My 8 Apr 2022 to 17 Apr 2022 short vacation back home only required me to buy 4 air tickets: Singapore - Kuala Lumpur - Bintulu return. Malaysia Airlines keeps rescheduling my flight timing until I needed to re-book with other airlines. Besides that, Malaysia Airlines will only refund me airport tax if I decide to cancel the flight (alternative timing not suitable) and go for refund, given that Malaysia Airlines is the one causing this inconvenience. There airline customer service centre is also taking their own sweet time - never answer incoming calls before 10am and after 7pm.

route: Melbourne to Dhaka via Kuala Lumpur
review: My connecting flight from KUL to DAC was scheduled at 8:0pm on 16 Mar. But when I arrived at Kuala Lumpur from Melbourne I realised the it had been rescheduled to 9:0am on the next day. No one notified about the change and I did not get any satisfactory answer from the staff in the airport. I immediately tried to organise hotel but there was no vacancy. So, I had to spend thirteen hours on the bench with chilling temperature overnight.  I am extremely disappointed because this happened before when I was about to miss my flight due to rescheduling of flight. Today, while coming back they again changed the Qantas flight but still no notification. The airline authority is very irresponsible and doesn't care about the passengers at all.

route: London to Brisbane via Kuala Lumpur
review: Pathetic service. Do not recommend this airline. Booked online, itinary changed twice. Had to book at a hotel for a 2 day layover at own expenses. Customer service is really pathetic, phone on hold for over an hour. Do not book this airline.

I don't know how many hours I have wasted dealing with Malaysia Airlines. At the end of the day I have absolutely nothing. Malaysia Airlines cancelled our flight in 2020, but we never got a refund or anything else. They promised a voucher or rebooking instead but I never got a reply how to do it, it doesn't matter how many times you ask. If you try to manage your booking online, nothing ever works.  It is very hard to reach the customer service and if you get a reply it's always useless, so as they haven't even read what I wrote. There are many bad customer services but Malaysia Airlines is surely the worst of all. So if you don't want any troubles, stay away of Malaysia Airlines.

route: Seoul to Kathmandu via Kuala Lumpur
review: The worst flight I have ever had. I bought a round trip ticket from Seoul to Nepal and also to come back Korea. So the day of my flight I reached Incheon Airport with my 22KG baggage. I checked the websites and it says, “23kg for Economy Class” But when I was doing my baggage checking the lady goes I don’t have any baggage attached with my ticket while my roundtrip was almost $850. When I purchased my ticket, it didn’t give me options if I want it with the baggage or without baggage. If I knew this I would have obviously selected with baggage. Just for one baggage I ended up paying $620 which doesn’t make sense as this amount is almost the price of round trip flight. Nothing make sense.

route: Jakarta to Hong Kong via Kuala Lumpur
review: Airline will change your ticket date without offering any refund. Airline just changed my ticket date to 4 days later, and refuse to offer any refund, even though we cannot fly on the new date. Changing the date of your ticket is like offering me another product altogether (Not what I initially wanted), and yet they refuse to make any refund. Apparently, even if they change your air ticket date to any future date, you are just supposed to accept it. Extremely unethical.

route: London to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. Appalling airline. They accepted our money and booked us onto a flight. Then cancelled our flight reservation for this flight and put us on another flight. Then cancelled this second reservation and put us on another flight. They claimed that the flights had been cancelled. We then found out that they’d actually just given our paid for seats to other people on both occasions. We were then told that we could travel on either flight if we paid extra for business class. So we were scammed.

route: Kuala Lumpur to San Fransisco via Doha
review: Absolute worst purchasing and refund experience. Made a booking online that was paid for but no ticket issued. Took 15mins+ on the phone for someone to pick up my call only to have them put me on hold and have the call drop. So tried again and waited another 15mins. When I explained the issue, all they could tell me was to make another payment while they refund the first one to trigger a ticket issuance in their system. However, there was no link for me to make another payment. So now my only option is to cancel my booking and wait 3 weeks for a refund. Did that, made a new booking for the exact same date, flights, and route and paid an additional RM60 only to have the same issue occur again. So wasted another hour on the phone with the contact centre - but at least this time the call centre agent managed to resolve the issue (which was a flight itinerary change in their system) and issued a ticket. But I've basically now RM5000+ (~USD1,000+) out of pocket waiting for a refund and paid RM60 more unnecessarily for having to make a new booking, and wasted 2 hours of my life. Never flying with them again.

route: Singapore to Kuantan via Kuala Lumpur
review: Multiple changes to the flight itinerary. No service recovery and no accommodation provided for a flight that has been delayed for more than 12hrs. Have been changing my flight itinerary more than two times due to the constant changing in the flight schedule. Hours were wasted to get into the call centre in order to change the flight. The overall experience has been terrible. Highly do not recommend this airline.

route: Colombo to Kuala Lumpur via Phuket
review: Extremely poor service. They cancelled our flight and gave us an option for 2 weeks later. No refund given and no option to rebook another flight. Just one advice: don't fly with Malaysia Airlines.

route: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: They are the worst airline I have dealt with in relation to changing flights, customer service, and refunds. I booked a return ticket to New Zealand from London for April 2022. They contacted me via email to say there had been a schedule change and to accept the new times. I did so as the new dates suited me ok. 2 days later I received another email asking me to accept another change, this time though the flights included 3-day layovers in KL airport when you cannot even leave the airport. I tried to contact them and spent an hour on the phone to be told they wouldn't cancel my ticket or issue me a refund. Luckily I knew that in the EU there is a law that if they change the actual flight number, so effectively canceling original booking they have to refund so I made a complaint quoting this law and they immediately changed their tune and said they could refund me. I haven't actually received the refund yet but they have promised me this should be within the next 7 days. I have found the whole process to be stressful, they have been unhelpful and after speaking to a few friends they had the exact same thing happen to them and took many months to get their money back. Also, I have done this route before with them before and it's not a pleasant experience. I will never fly with them again.

Mediocre business class product. Only 2 of us on this flight in whole biz cabin! Food poor, no written menu, just told by FA choice between canteen-style food (dry, chewy lamb). Satay was ok but that’s it. For wine, offered ‘red’ or ‘white’. Seat comfortable enough, showing its age, dated IFE, no nice bedding provided. Toiletries basic. Service was nice enough but lacking personalisation. A sub-par biz product. No good lounge in KL, had to wait 7 hrs in mostly closed, deserted airport. Transit handled poorly.

route: London to Langkawi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Joined MAS Enrich programme after I'm being continuously bombarded by emails requests to do so, but once a member, I get more emails with "fly away" very annoying comments like; earn your enrich points via manage my booking online. Now what, where, how is that? These ridiculous fly away comments implies you must know what they're saying, well frankly I don't, and I find it insulting frankly, to imply rather then advise appropriately. Emailed MAS, a reply three days later, sounded more condescending, with exactly the same fly away comment but this time as if adding salt to injury states, call our customer service if need help! Finally with a friend, we went onto their website, clicked manage my bookings, got into my actual flight details but no where we could see that mentions enrich? After much poking around, we found it further embedded in My details! but when I try to type in MH number, that input box is locked! Computer says no! We gave up, total waste of time

I purchased an upgrade to Business Suite ticket from Kuala Lumpur to London but was wrongly issued a Business Class ticket by the call centre. Staff at the airport counter acknowledged the error and secured me the Business Suite seat minus the service. I received a waiting time of more than 1 hour for the staff at the check in counter to check and verify my ticket. Time wasted in having to check in my luggage at the oversized luggage counter due to the delay above. No assistance was offered to check in my luggage even though I am from Business Suite and was late for my flight. Staff at Business Suite counter walked off while attending to me halfway through. Was left to wait for 20 minutes before seeking help from other counters.  Forced to sign an indemnity form by staff at the counter absolving MAS of any responsibilities.  Entertainment system in seat 1H was down.  No Business Suite meals as my ticket was deemed to be a last minute upgrade although it was purchased in advance.  Called the toll free complaint line and was given empty promises that MAS will revert back. Got through to the CEO's email through a contact and was assigned a person in Customer Relations and Quality Assurance to sort my case out. After investigating, they stated  "Please allow us to once again clarify that the payment collected for MYR 35,593.00 was for the upgrade from Economy Class to Business Class and not for Business Suite.". According to him, "Regrettably, the agent being fairly new at our Global Contact Centre had unintentionally advised Mr. Teoh that the ticket was on a ‘First Class Business seat’ although she had meant to advise that the ticket was actually on ’Business Class seat’.". This is misrepresentation of sales and is a fraud! I was offered 30000 Enrich points as a "goodwill gesture".  After further investigation, they concluded that my ticket was issued wrongly and the correct ticket is a Business Suite ticket.  When I asked if I could be compensated in another manner instead of points, the response I got was "We are offering this compensation to you in good faith and we will not be pursuing this matter further. If you feel otherwise you may proceed with your necessary Statutory rights, of which we will defend accordingly." So, not only you issued me a wrong ticket, you can't conduct a proper investigation, you have no sense of responsibility to explain why the outcome of the investigation is different and your plan is to challenge your Business Suite passenger to court?

route: Auckland to Delhi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Worst company rescheduling the flight without asking, and now not even returning the money. They are really a worst airline company. Never understand the feelings of the person what they are going through.

I had a horrible experience with unreliability of Malaysia Airlines flight schedule and their irresponsibility when I booked the tickets on Colombo-Phuket flight (via Kuala-Lumpur) with them in the middle of January 2022. First, I have booked the flight for February 12, 2022 but on January 26 I received a notification that my flight was cancelled "due to recent developments/movement control restrictions enacted to curb the spread of the Covid-19 pandemic". No channel of contact was offered, and I had to find out myself that the only way to contact the airline regarding the issue is the phone hotline in Malaysia - very convenient, considering the 5-minute robotic prompts of "press one" type and the charges for international calls. After that I was assured that the flight could be rescheduled to February 19, 2022, so I went with that - only to receive another notification on February 3, 2022 that this flight is cancelled due to the same reasons.  I had to book another flight to another destination in Thailand with another airline at a much higher price, which could have been much lower if I booked it in advance in the first place.

Did fly from Sydney to Kuala Lumpur the 8th of January. This is about an 8 hour flight and you gave me a bread roll in business class? No choice of dinner? That is totally unacceptable. No lounges were open. I think you are cutting corners to save money but your clients are still paying full fares. You won't see me back again and will tell as many people that want to hear about this.

route: Johor Bahru to Chicago via Kuala Lumpur / Doha
review: Bought two air ticket departing from Johor Bahru to Chicago via Kuala Lumpur and Doha for August 2021. Received an email 6 days before departure that my whole flight was cancelled and was reschedule August 8, 2021. However the third sector from Doha to Chicago was not confirmed. I called many times and asked customer services what can they do? They all said just go there and wait if there anyone cancelled their flight then you can go. The other way is to change to open ticket? Why would I want to spend a few thousand for a ticket and made it Open ticket? Ask for cancellation, Customer service said here is a US200 penalty for each ticket. That is US400. First you cancel my flight but I check Qatar is still flying on the same day. Postpone my flight to another day but cannot confirmed the 3rd sector of my trip. Ask me to write and have to wait for 7 to 14 days to have someone to look into this matter. Now that I cannot make my trip and there is no flight for the next 7 days or more. I think the whole experience with Mas airline is terrible and I have made more than 10 calls and most of them hang up in the middle of the call as they couldn’t help me in anyway. I have been a loyal and support using Mas airline for most of my trips. But this one is truly a very disappointing one. Why do you sell the tickets when you cannot commit to delivering them. I was forced to cancel my tickets as they cannot provide any tickets for me so I have to rebook two other tickets to make the trip. The refund take up to 3 to 4 months. I am really disgusted that I still have to pay for penalty for cancellation where the airline cannot fulfil its services to their customer. It was a horrible experience that the airline has put me through the hassle of hotel and transport cancellation and rearrangement.

MAS used to be somewhat a national pride for Malaysia but as of now I would not recommend anyone to fly with Malaysia Airlines as they are taking bookings for flights they have no intention of flying under the pretense of COVID. I booked a flight last month to KUL which was promptly cancelled by the airline less than 24 hours later, and the airline refused to rebook me on an alternative flight. I had to rebook with SQ, while my money is stuck with MH as they refuse to refund. I will be lodging a complaint with MAVCOM.

route: Perth to Hanoi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Flight got cancelled by Malaysia Airlines (Covid-19) and since then I have been asking for a refund of the ticket fees. With West Australian borders closed for 2020 and 2021, there is no way we could have travelled - yet they refuse to give our money back and sorry is only reply I get from customer service . This is beyond frustrating.

Check-in was a little disappointing because the queue was very long but only a couple of check-in counters were available. Priority check-in counter was not easy to spot without any signage or marker. The boarding procedure was great as they board passengers from the last row to the front (business class passengers is prioritized obviously). Cabin crew were satisfying, although some just stares at you as you walk through the aisle looking for your seat. Since it is a domestic flight, blanket and pillow is not provided except headset. The headset was the same headset I used over 5 years ago so it would be great if they change it to a better headset. The IFE system is decent, although it is not responsively occasionally. The entertainment content is great and up to date. In this flight, the food choices were Noodle with Chicken and Nasi Lemak. I chose the noodle and it was decent. The portion is enough for me but the sauce used is a little bland. Usually the meal will come with a few snacks, but this time only the salted peanut is provided together with a water bottle. The beverage choices were great, although my favourite guava juice was not available. The seat was decent, but it is the same seat I sat 5 years ago. There was no changes to the seats, so it is a little disappointing. If there are any changes needed, it would be changing the leather seat to a smoother and softer seat with headrest. Overall, it is a decent flight but some things need to change because it is outdated.

route: Sydney to Manila via Kuala Lumpur
review: Had a booking cancelled and been waiting for almost 7 months now for my refund. The reason for cancellation is not even my fault, they rescheduled my 3rd flight and advanced it by one day making the whole trip useless as I would've arrived at Kuala Lumpur to transit to another flight that already took off a day before I even arrive. Never given other options, and it looks like they also do not want to give my money back.

route: Bengaluru to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: This review is related to booking and cancelling process and not actual travel of Malaysian Airlines. I had raised a booking for May 2022 to travel from Bangalore to Bali with my family. Due to other reasons and also COVID guidelines of quarantine, decided to cancel the ticket. First i had to call the helpdesk which is Malaysian number and had to wait for 30-40 mins twice to get connected. After that the support person says I am eligible for refund but it will take 3 to 6 months for refund and also the refund money they said they cannot say and asked to call again after a month to check status. Each month i need to follow up to get my money back is what it looks like. Now i am not sure if i will get my money back and if yes by when is still a mystery. This is the first time i had booked this airline and this information sharing to others to ensure they are aware of this issue and be careful choosing this airline. Also the support team said they cannot send any email on cancelling as well, asked to check in airline website the status will be cancelled. So now i am confused what is the proof of refund?

route: Melbourne to Chennai via Kuala Lumpur
review: I purchased return flights to go from Melbourne to Chennai for December 2021. The tickets were already expensive at $2,800 return but I have been waiting to see my parents back home in India and was prepared to pay the high fares. I tried for 2 hours to book tickets directly through the Malaysian Airlines website but I kept getting error. I therefore had to book the tickets via 3rd party - Trip.com Then the airlines canceled the flights, after which I contacted Trip.com for a refund. I was told the airline would not refund any money and only provide a travel voucher to be used before Dec 2022. I then contacted the airline and after much persuasion and heated discussion the agent agreed to charge a cancellation fee of $200. I questioned this charge, as the flight was cancelled by the airline so I do not understand why I should be the one to pay a penalty. The agent said this policy is mentioned in my ticket booking. I asked him to direct me to where I can view this policy. There was no cancellation policy within my booking. I requested the agent to send me a screenshot which I could see and confirm. He said he was unable to email me anything. I have since spent hours and much of my frustration talking/emailing Trip.com and the airlines but to no avail. It is very clear that the airlines and travel agents such as Trip.com are easily abdicating any responsibility and are taking advantage by fleecing customers like me. The airline says sorry, you didn't book through us and Trip.com says its the airline decision. Even if I did rebook for later, the tickets are expected to be cheaper than $2,800 certainly. So the airline have made money by cancelling the flight, the travel agents have made money and we as customers desperate to see family are at the mercy of these entities.

route: Auckland to Mumbai via Kuala Lumpur
review: We had tickets booked by Malaysia Airlines to fly from Auckland NZ, to Mumbai, India during Dec 2020. Due to the pandemic the flights from NZ were cancelled. We now need to travel to India in December this year, however I understand the flights are not operational to NZ route. But dealing with their customer service team is a nightmare. First of all there is no option at all for a refund or a partial refund minus the booking fees or whatever. Secondly I have hardly had any responses to my queries about my refund on compassionate grounds as the only reason we need to travel is due to personal family reasons. We would prefer flying them as we already have tickets, however if they aren't operating flights, they should at least partially refund our money so we can make other arrangements. So far I have 0 responses to my messages to them. Their call centre staff were unable to help me with our flights as they are unsure when the route will begin operating. Now we have booked our tickets with another airline to travel in Dec with the unwanted Malaysia airlines tickets still on our name which they only keep extending so we can rebook another date, even though we do not have travel plans in the future after this date. Now it is not my problem that they aren't operating on the dates we need to fly on. Again I would have preferred using them but since they aren't operating flights to NZ, I am stuck with an extra ticket to India on which I may not travel anytime soon in the foreseeable future. Thanks Malaysia airlines for nothing. Customer service gets a 0 for ignoring all my messages. Will never choose to travel with them ever again. Happy to pay extra for other airlines and get the assurance of customer service.

route: Melbourne to Bengaluru via Kuala Lumpur
review: Stay away from Malaysia Airlines I have booked tickets in March 2020 from MEL to BLR for a family of 4 and the travel is cancelled due to pandemic. After a long struggle and multiple calls to Airlines, they issued travel vouchers. I thought I could use these vouchers next time I travel. But, it remained as a dream. Surprisingly they issued MH-Evouchers when things are settled and deducted A$150 for each ticket. In addition, one of E-voucher is not redeemable. Prolonged waiting time and multiple calls each day to customer care doesn't yield any desired results. The customer care is really useless, every-time during the call they go through all details and comes up with standard answer- 'We are sorry sir, we know that it's an issue but we can't do much about it' This is going for multiple hours for the past 7 days. I haven't expected such unprofessional & below standard response. Even, the ticket prices are tripled now when things are slowly getting normal. The website is either slow or doesn't work at all most of the times.

Still waiting on a full refund for a planned flight in June 202o, after multiple calls, emails, bank disputed transactions and legal notice of demand. Keep away from this unethical airline. The audacity to still sell flights from Australia while hundreds of customers are waiting for their refunds. The mentality of those managing the customer service, public relations and management is a warning sign to safely stayaway from booking flights with them.

route: Colombo to Myanmar via Kuala Lumpur
review: They cancelled my flight at the start of COVID 18 months ago and will not return any money not even the extra that I paid for seat allocation, the voucher they have given me is worthless and will now not even get me to KL (half the distance that I had originally paid for). I run a small hotel in Sri Lanka and I gave everyone who cancelled with me a full refund because it was the honest & right thing to do, now I am in no position to go on holiday so the money would be big help to me. You can steal from people once but they will never return. I would expect more from a national carrier, shame on you.

I am a Malaysian and sorry to say Malaysia Airlines  is being the worse airline from my flight experiences, my flight has been cancelled 2 times without any sms or calls. I open my apps only I discovered my itinerary was disappear, than after I realized flight was cancelled via email. Called up customer service and their replied was not friendly and refund will only be made in 6 months. Please note that I was aware of the cancellation just 3 days before my flight. I’m on a business trip and imagine the hassle that I had.

I was flying from Sydney to Mumbai on the 3rd January 2021. Flight got canceled and I received a single email, but then they still tried to check me in via sms? Had to call to confirm if it was actually cancelled. Later I was told that they will deduct over 200 USD as admin charges on a refundable ticket! And when I asked for a timeline for a refund - they don’t have a time line, there is a minimum wait of over 8 months. Seriously? At least provide us with something. This is extremely unprofessional.

route: Kathmandu to Adelaide via Kuala Lumpur
review: Worst airline experience when covid hit back in March. I was in Nepal and had a flight booked for 23 March (it was 19 March). Heard a rumour that KTM airport was going to close in 24 hours. Went straight to Malaysia Airlines office the next morning. Was told that “yes the flight is cancelled however our system has yet to be updated so you will have to pay the difference and claim it back later”. I had no choice and they knew it, the flight they were moving me to was to depart in 3 hours, so I had to get back to the hotel, pack and rush to the airport. So my original flight was already double the normal price and I then got charged that and a bit more again... so paid quadruple the normal price in total.  I went round and round in circles for 8 months where they even claimed not to have an office in KTM (I sent them a photo of it via google to disprove this particular lie). So, as with many others, no refund as promised or travel voucher or anything.

route: Perth to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur
review: Perth to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur. Was due to fly in April but was cancelled by airline in March. No refund has been given, being told it was non refundable ticket, yet nothing states this.

route: London to Miri via Kuala lumpur
review: Due to Malaysian border closed could not travel, asked for refund, told to fill in bank detail. Called every week to check refund weekly but every time told in the process, can’t tell how long before I get refund. Then a month later told me to fill in bank detail again. No reason given. I paid by credit card , their email message is - due to insolvency of payment partner Wirecard where customer purchased their tickets with non Malaysian Ringgit were unfortunately being rejected/ hold under Wirecard. Therefore refund will need process through bank transfer. A lot of lies, from other complaints online, don’t believe Malaysian airlines have intention of refunding customers. Poor service will never fly with this airline. The call centre will just lied & said they don’t due with refund, can’t help.

route: Auckland to Delhi via Kuala Lumpur
review: I booked tickets 7 months ago to travel in November 2020, the flight has been canceled. Malaysia Airlines not willing to refund ticket, and keeping travel restrictions to finish travel 31st December 2021 and booking has to made before June 2021 to utilize that money, If I don't travel with given dates, I cant utilize anymore that money.

route: Miri to Bali via Kota Kinabalu
review: We have booked 5 flights with Malaysia Airlines in October this year, economy and business class. In the mean time we received approx. 20 changes in the scheduling. Some flights changed a few minutes, 3 of the 5 flights were completely rescheduled: 1 flight 2 days later, 1 flight 1 day later and 1 flight 1 day earlier. There was a very quick reply after a request for reimbursement: not applicable while extra ordinary circumstances. They simply refuse any flexibility, no compensation, no hotel. Nothing. The policy of Malaysian is clearly to use the uncertainty to earn a lot of money, because people are forced to rebook or cancel flights. Their extended flexibility-policy allows one to rebook flights by 31 December and travel by 30 June 2021. It is a very short period if you are from overseas. Having a pretty complex itinerary, there is only one thing we can do: cancel,and never book again with Malaysia Airlines. A zero star rating in the review is unfortunately not possible.

Malaysia Airlines are providing vouchers instead of refunding flights impacted by corona virus. Unfortunately MAS are stipulating you have to rebook by December and have completed flights by June 2021. This is less than 1 year now and getting less every day. Most airlines are offering 1 year from original flight dates, some are 2 years.

Excellent boarding process, economy class seats were comfortable with huge amounts of leg room (behind the divider or the door). Great source of entertainment with a large screen which is responsive.  For a 7 hour plus flight, they gave out so many snacks ranging from Japanese style to Malaysian style. For food and beverages it would be a 5 star. Landing wise was average a little on the hard side.
Airline cancelled flight, refuses to refund any money and is offering to rebook tickets at twice the price (equivalent dates). It is cheaper to buy a brand new ticket elsewhere.

We have actually not yet flown. Our flight was due to go in July 2020. I was trying to get a voucher because of COVID19 through the booking agent (mytrip.com) with no success so finally contacted Malaysia Airlines direct. The representative was very helpful, no problem that we had booked through an agent, and processed the voucher request immediately. I had it in my inbox within 3 hours of the phone call. And, to my surprise, we were awarded a credit 20% higher in value than the original booking. Now, this is a really responsive airline! First, I did not have to wait until the flight was due to depart in order to get the voucher, and they have been very flexible and generous in their response! Well done Malaysia Airlines.

Malaysia Airlines cancelled my flight and put me on a flight the next day. They sent me an email. No questions, if the flight on the next day is good for me, nothing at all, you fly the next day. So I wrote to them an email to avoid significant roaming charges. In my first email I asked if they are going to provide any accommodation or any kind of compensation because i booked a hotel in my destination and now I was going to lose a night I paid for plus i needed another hotel in Kuala lumpur. They replied they are not going to provide anything.  No customer care, no intentions of help or even replying to your email. I lost 200 euros, because it was for 2 persons. Anyway, I left it at that now, but just wanted to warn other travellers.

On 24th of march I booked a ticket from Penang to Kuala Lumpur for my wife. After trying to get news from them unanswered, since it was possible I decided to book online. After one minute flight was canceled but money not returned, as they want to convert it in credit or use before end of the year. Why sell tickets and then immediately cancel? Why you don't refund immediately?

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. The staff was friendly, the seats were comfortable, although the flight was not full. It is significant for a short-haul flight that the aircraft was provided with entertainment. Food and service were fine for a such short flight. Boarding was good with friendly and welcoming crew.

Both my son and i booked tickets to fly out from Kuala Lumpur on the 18/3/2020 at 2235 via MH135 and expected time of arrival in Brisbane at 8.40am on Thursday. When we arrived at the terminal, we checked in via the kiosk, only our luggage tags were printed. we were told to go to the ticketing counter to get the boarding passes. Upon reaching the counter, staff informed us that passengers with Malaysian passports weren't allowed to fly out and therefore she won't be able to print out the boarding pass for us. Unhappy with what she said , i proceded to call Immigration Malaysia on 03 87763681 stationed in KLIA, I spoke to an officer who said since we are permanent residents and with long term visa, we should be able to fly out. Taking his word I approached staff  again to inform her of what was told to me. She wasn't happy with what I did, so she insisted on taking all our documents over to the Immigration Malaysia herself. According to her, she went over to counter 23 of immigration and consulted an officer stationed there, who according also confirmed that we could not fly as our documents were insufficient and we didn't have the PR Card. The documents that we had on us was issued by Immigration Australia with their logo and crest of the federal government on it, In spite of that, she still insists that that paperwork was insufficient and again insisted on the PR Card. I informed her that we were just granted our visas, and told her that we weren't going to Australia for a holiday but to return home. Staff again took matters into her hands and even went to the extend of calling up Australian Immigration to confirm the authenticity of the documents and of our claims of being residents. In spite of getting the confirmation from the Australian Immigration, she insisted that she won't be able to issue the boarding pass and refused to put in a word to Immigration Malaysia to confirm that we could fly out. The third time I called the Immigration Malaysia number, this time this officer said that we could not fly out. I told her that i have already checked in and that the kiosk printed out my luggage tags, to which she said we still can't fly out, so i explained to her that that action of checking in needed to be undone but she just brushed it off and told us to go to counter 3. After 4 and the half hours or so of dealing with this woman and the contradicting feedbacks from the immigration officers, we headed to counter 3 for a refund. An young man with a Hospitality T-shirt approched us and saw the visa grants that i was holding and he called out to another lady to help us out, This Good Samaritan refused to give up but insisted on dragging us back to see staff.  This good Samaritan helped us by approaching the Immigration Malaysia and managed to get their approval. They went on to MH office to get our boarding passes. When we checked in, staff left a "not allowed to travel" in the system and left w/out undoing her mistake.

Kuala Lumpur to Colombo. It was all good except that the entire experience was spoiled by one crew member. The male crew member who was extremely rude and for sure doesn't give a damn to the customer experience or satisfaction. When I requested for a vegetarian option, his answer was  "we dont have vegetarian option, you should have informed your travel agent, take either chicken or fish". I asked him is there anything you can assist me with, came the reply no.

Kuala Lumpur to Sydney return. Good flight over and great flight back. Malaysia Airlines economy product is almost always good. Though it does depend on the crew. On these two flights the crew were excellent, especially the return sector. Above and beyond in friendliness and "can do" attitude to requests. Looking great in their uniforms. Food was good. The main meal always feels a bit small for me. And one was served just a degree or two above cold but the flight attendant got me a warmer one off another trolley. MAS take note - we westerners do not like hot food served any other way but piping hot. Especially during covid19 concerns. The snacks served at the end of the journeys were excellent and hot. Greatly improved from previous journeys. Nice touch is crew walking the aisles with a tray full of beers on departure from Sydney. Since the passengers are Australians or Indians, its greatly appreciated. Dont expect it on departure from KL. IFE quite good. Seats getting on in years but Ok. Cabin colours very pleasant. Both flights ontime or early.  Often offering very reasonable fares for the quality of the product, I would highly recommend.

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur, Great check-in Time. So helpful check-in Counter staff. The flight is smooth, on-time. The flight attendant is nice. The inflight meal is cake (pandan) and peanut. The pandan cake is delicious, I like it.

route: Mumbai to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Mumbai to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. My husband passed away on our trip to India and as we both had a return ticket from India to Australia, I requested for his ticket to be changed to my daughter’s name so she could accompany me back home. From Malaysia Airlines, there was no level of compassion shown - I was not asking for a free ticket. I was ready to pay for the penalty on the name change but under no circumstances did they consider my request; they neither cancelled my late husband’s ticket and at a time of loss, with the stress of the funeral arrangements, my family had to stress about getting a new ticket for my daughter to travel back with me. A death in the family is a deeply distraught moment in a persons life - some level of compassion goes a long way in showing support and assistance, this process with the airline has made me rethink of ever using them.

Brisbane to Kuala Lumpur. Warm greetings from cabin crew upon boarding the plane. Service was fine. Cabin crew interacted with me in a professional manner. Meal service started with the Malaysian Satays, which was excellent. The main course, a chicken dish was not the best. The flat bed was comfortable enough to allow me a few hours of sleep. The IFE has a limited selection of movies, needs a much wider selection. No amenity kit was provided for a 8 hour flight, a bit disappointing. The service from the crew was excellent.

Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. Malaysian hospitality at its worst and filthy seats. Check in took us 45 minutes despite being 4th in the row. The check-in desk was manned by inefficient members. This was followed with seats that hadn’t been cleaned and the floor in front of us had food scraps. The cabin crew did not acknowledge requests for anything and their attitude is easily the worst.

route: Kochin to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: Kochin to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur. Crew is not happy and service was not good for me.  Will get two meals in between those two meals there is more than 7 hours difference. I don't recommend Malaysian airlines. If I asked something the crew doesn't reply or respond to me.

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Totally disappointed on this flight. The regional golden lounge was not worth going into so I went to the other lounge. Aircraft change from A330 to Boeing 737. Onboard crew were friendly but once seated the aircraft was hot. Crew served welcome drinks and hot towels, my meal was bland dry beef with chutney.

Kuala Lumpur to London. Flight departed on time. My main issue was that cabin crew did not address the passengers by their names anymore, which this was a unique way of service touch point used by MAS for so long. It was sad seeing this no longer in use, not even a “Sir” or “Madam” used in between conversations, flight was smooth, was hoping for an extraordinary service but it was not given.

Denpasar to Kuala Lumpur. Excellent flight with a very comfy full flat seat. The crew was exceptionally friendly and eager to please and to deliver a First class service even though the Business class cabin was full. Glad to see Malaysia Airlines has resumed serving alcohol as the flight was only 2h30mn. I recommend highly them.

route: Brunei to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: Brunei to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. I made a cancellation recently because my workplace made an announcement that travelling isn't advisable at this time due to the spread of Wuhan/Corona virus. Since I was going through KL to go to Penang, I thought this was wise. A friend travelling to Penang from South Korea also cancelled her tickets, and she did it a few days after me. And she got pver 70% refund of her tickets with a $100 cancellation fee. The flight was about 3 weeks away at that point. What seems bizarre to me is this: I cancelled my ticket days before this friend and out of the $513, I only received $31. When I wrote to customer care, this particular staff kept stressing on their flight advisory for flight to and from China. The staff handling this issue kept dodging my request for this breakdown of cancellation charges, and never really answered my questions.

Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. The cabin crew were rude and disengaged to me. They did not help my wife with her overhead baggage at all and stood staring. When asking for our meal options, the cabin crew did not seem to have the patience.

Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. Airplane cabin was very noisy and the food were ordinary. I think flight attendants were not patient specially a man that serve in our row, he was a little impolite. Airport service was good.

Kuala Lumpur to Mumbai. The satay is one of best thing in this flight. Crew were very polite. Very good taste of food. Malaysia Airlines Golden Lounge with the new refurbished set up is one of the best lounge in the region.

Perth to Kuala Lumpur. Malaysia Airlines currently flies A330-200 which are former Air Berlin aircrafts. Business class seats come with full lie-down flat bed which is quite comfortable to get some rest especially on a midnight flight. The aircraft is a little aged but is still well kept. Business class passengers have access to priority check-in and boarding at Perth Airport, and access to Qantas International Lounge. Onboard the aircraft, the Malaysia Airlines crew has definitely shown me a true Malaysian Hospitality. The crew takes the time to know our names, and greet each passengers politely, e.g. Mr Smith. The highlight of Malaysia Airlines business class flight is their signature satay and the crew spoiled me today with a generous serve of the satay and generous portion of the peanut sauce. For dinner, I chose the roasted chicken which is cooked beautifully and to perfection. After dinner, most passengers have lied down their bed and slept. We were each given a pillow and a blanket. Before arriving, the crew went around for another serve of beverages. I chose the teh tarik (literally translates as pull tea) which is a signature beverage among the local. Before I alight the aircraft, the crew wishes me Gong Hei Fatt Choi which is an auspicious saying for any Chinese celebrating Chinese New Year. It is tiny gesture like this that makes me walk away not only being well fed but truly experiencing what Malaysian Hospitality is all about.

route: Mumbai to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Mumbai to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. They issued me invoice in AUD but charged my CC in USD which made my trip expensive and they won't refund. The aircraft was dirty and toilet I used was not clean. We had issues loading our cabin luggage and the food was spicy. The staff had no smile on the face and professionalism was missing. They lost my baggage and its been 2 days now and I still haven't received my baggage. I have been calling the baggage service since past 2 days and no one is responding back nor replying to my emails or voicemails. The flights were not cheap even, I paid Christmas fares. No compensation or correction offered.

route: Perth to Delhi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Perth to Delhi via Kuala Lumpur. I booked with Malaysia Airlines. The day I was to fly they delayed my flight for 2 hours. Later I was in the airport in Perth then again delayed. All passengers got frustrated. I missed my next flight because of this. I had to spend money again to rebook the ticket. I will never ever use this airline again.

route: Auckland to London via Kuala Lumpur
review: Don't use this airline. I will never ever use these people again. I flew from Auckland to London today, with stopover at Kuala Lumpur. The Auckland flight was first delayed by 2 hours due to engineering issues. This caused me to miss my connecting flight. We were issued a replacement flight, but had to wait from 9am to 11.30pm to get on this flight. I told them I need to get on an earlier flight due to work. There has to be an earlier flight to London during a 15 hour period! Then what I experienced was the most unhelpful, unapologetic customer service at the Transfer Desk. They lied to me that there was no flight earlier (there was). The worst is the so called manager - when the front desk briefed him on the issue, decided to ignore us and walked to another line to talk to other customers - and the next available flight for me was in less than an hour! When I finally spoke to him, he asked me 'what is the flight number you want to be put on?' What a ridiculous question coming from the airline. By the time they faffed around 1 hour later, I wouldn't get on the earlier flight - I doubt they ever intended to get me on it with their attitude. During my 1 hour of waiting, I heard a girl screaming at them that "I already bought 3 tickets", and she still couldn't fly. Two others said their flight was delayed but they were not notified. A few others not offered hotel when they had to wait from 9 to 4pm. Very disappointing customer service, the only nice thing was the front desk girl who had helped me to with directions to the airport hotel, after feeling bad for the actions of her superiors.

route: Perth to Guangzhou via Kuala Lumpur
review: Perth to Guangzhou via Kuala Lumpur. This is absolutely the worst flying experience I have ever had. The plane is retimed 1 hour late. Then delayed another 2 hours. Then another 2 hours. Then another 2 hours! Absolutely shocking and no apology or compensation or anything. The staff are abysmally rude and do not take the customers seriously. I will never fly Malaysia airlines again!

route: Phnom Penh to Cochin via Kuala Lumpur
review: I flew from Cochin to Phnom Penh by Malaysia Airlines last week and the service was great. Today (14 January 2020) I am going back to Cochin, during my check in at Phnom Penh I had very bad experience. I waited in line for long time, the economy lane gone more faster, then when I asked the lady at check in why it is taking too long for business class, she shouted at me, she said we have problems and all are business class, not only you. If she said it politely I wouldn’t have written this, but shouting is very bad response.

Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne with Malaysia Airlines. Took off on time and cabin announcements were clear. Ground staff service efficient. Golden Lounge big but lack ambience. Service by cabin attendants generally was poor and somewhat remote. Food was disappointing being very average. Cheese and items after mains etc as per Menu Card were not offered on this particular trip and no explanation was given. Cabin staff were not very engaging. Incredibly no breakfast was provided after a night flight on this trip. It seems like the cabin lights came on just as landing announcements were made.

Kuala Lumpur to Sydney in Economy Extra Leg Room. My TV Screen would just drop down every now and then. My wife Headset had a loud crackle and static. I ordered a Gluten Free meal. I received Fish that was was dry. I don't expect good food on an aircraft but this was the worst meal that I have ever been served.  I received a snack about 2 hours before landing. I asked for a glass of water that was served from a jug and the water was warm. The aircraft was far from clean. We used wipes to clean the arm rests and the wipes ended up far from white.  I will go back to Malaysia but I would rather go via a connection with another airline than directly with MAS and I'm sorry for all the good people that work for Malaysian.

route: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur. I booked 4 flights in April 2019 to travel in January 2020 and within weeks of booking Malaysia Airlines changed 2 of them to different days and times. As they had not changed the other 2 flights they would not give me a full refund if I cancelled. The new flight times cost me an extra £250 in hotels, but even more frustrating the new flight schedule was £600 cheaper than my original itinerary, but Malaysia Airlines would not offer any reduction. After many months of dealing with an inconsiderate company they gave me a token number of air miles. This compensation cannot be used to book seats and is not even enough to get access to their airport lounge. Their Customer Service is so poor; a web site contact only; delayed responses; being pushed from one department to another and just an overall disregard for the customer.

Kuala Lumpur to London Heathrow. Check in was straight forward and quick as was  immigration and security. Greeted at the aircraft door with a warm welcome and a smile. Took off on time and cabin announcements were clear. Shortly after takeoff peanut and drinks service then after about an hour in flight first meal service commenced. Choice was Asian or European dish with a choice of wine or soft drinks. Meal consisted of salad, main, desert and cheese and warm roll. More drinks followed and throughout the 14.5 hour flight or were available at the rear of the aircraft. Breakfast offered 2 hours prior to landing with again 2 choices and hot drinks. Throughout the flight the toilets were cleaned frequently. The service was very polite and courteous with lots of interaction with the crew if you were willing to chat but otherwise slightly low key. Leg room was satisfactory but the entertainment system was easy to use and rapid loading the films were slightly outdated and not the best.

Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne. I have flown Malaysia Airlines business class many times due to needing to join my airline from KL. I would love to say they have improved however the sad truth is, they haven't. I would have to say that the Golden Lounge in KL was excellent, with attentive staff and great showers and food. The flight was prompt and on time. The crew seemed a bit remote and did not engage. I almost felt like I was imposing on them to ask for anything. The food was average and the satays were now down the 4 sticks instead of 6. The wine I had was average and one glass I had was corked. I really hope Malaysian get their act together as it is a good option out of Australia. There would be minimal cost as most of the issues seem to stem from a lack of customer-focused service.

Malaysia Airlines is currently flying its flagship aircraft A350-900 XWB between Kuala Lumpur and Sydney. Business class passengers have priority check-in and boarding privileges, and in Sydney passengers will be given express security screening pass as well which is helpful. At Sydney Airport, they do not make any announcement about boarding so passengers are advised to go to the gate at the time stated on your boarding pass. Upon boarding, the Malaysia Airlines cabin crew are really warm and friendly. Business class passengers are welcomed with juices and cold towel. The seat on A350 is pretty spacious with different compartments for your personal items such as iPad and iPhone. The seat has 3 modes: upright, relax and lie-flat bed, and they are quite comfortable to sleep in on a long haul flight. Passengers are given a pillow and blanket, as well as amenity kit. No pyjamas are supplied. Malaysia Airlines consistently deliver their delicious signature satay and I was lucky to be given two servings of satay. For lunch, I had Tasmanian Salmon, Chef Nell’s Rib Eye and seasonal fruit. The rib eye was not cooked to tender (meat does not fall off your fork) which is a let-down. The taste for both my entree and main are well done. The inflight entertainment OS is pretty smooth and responsive. However, it has very limited range of choices. I have completed SYD-KUL earlier in 2019 and one of the senior crew had such a really high benchmark in terms of service and hospitality, and thus comparing this experience to my previous one, I am less impressed with the service. The flight was overall uneventful, and the crew was friendly and responsive to most passengers

Kuala Lumpur to Perth. Cabin crew service was amazing, food selection provided was great, IFE was excellent, the lavatory was clean. As a Malaysian I really feel proud with my national carrier and will continue to do so.

Perth to Kuala Lumpur with Malaysia Airlines. My flight was twice delayed but sufficient notification was being sent. Great ground agent service always with a smile. Cabin crew were friendly and efficient. Food was of great quality, IFE working well and seats are comfortable. Will fly with them again. Proud of my national carrier.

route: Kathmandu to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Kathmandu to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. Horrible service by staff who were rude right until we landed. Meals were only warm, entertainment was very slow to load. Overpriced and would not fly again

I flew business from Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur on 18th December. This was by far the worst flight experience I have ever had. The level of service was way below what you expect from even an economy flight in other airlines. The airplane was untidy and messy. The business crew kept changing and they never happened to take orders or requests properly. To start with, there was no headset available and as a result of that I couldn't use any entertainment! The cabin was so cold and there was no blanket available; I had to beg couple of crew and ask few times to get a single small blanket! I pre-ordered my main dish online the day before the flight; which was never delivered to me! I asked one of the crew about the dinner but didn't get a clear answer or explanation. I presume that the food was either eaten by crew or another passenger or never existed. This was unbelievable. Adding to the list, the toilets were constantly engaged or locked by crew themselves for no reason. It was a real challenge to find a vacant toilet during the flight. This was a disappointing experience. For such a long flight and a business ticket, the service was extremely poor. I will never try Malaysia Airlines and would suggest you not to waste your money there and simply go for another airline.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. The Entertainment Touchscreen was not working. I cannot complain about it because the flight is only 45 minutes from Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. The flight is still good. The outbound flight is still acceptable even without a working touchscreen.

London to Kuala Lumpur. Awful, rude customer service. The only way to make a complaint is by using their web form, which doesn't work. It doesn't recognise words like, United Kingdom and asks you to verify characters that aren't shown. There is only a phone number for reservations, but they won't help you if there's an issue. The airline damaged my suitcase and won't offer any compensation. I paid extra of an exit seat, but had to move seats because the exit seat was so crowded. They take a very long time to respond by email. I will never book with Malaysia Airlines again.

route: Phnom Penh to Ho Chi Minh City via Kuala Lumpur
review: Phnom Penh to Ho Chi Minh City via Kuala Lumpur. Flew SGN-KUL-PNH and back mid December 2019 on their old B737-800 which are about to have passed their silver weddings. Check-in in SGN was a breeze as usual – I came earlier and found an open counter from the previous flight and - vupti - got all my 4 BPs issued instantly which allowed me early lounge access in the Le Saigonnais which is new and very nice though not world class. Onboard, smooth travels and nice, huge, decliner, classic, comfortable business class seats. Up to 16 seats in business which were full or almost full on all sectors. I ordered special meal which was delivered on all 4 sectors. Tried also a non-special meal on all 4 sectors. Food acceptable and 3 choices and menu cards were handed out. No alcohol, but you can bring your own discretely and they’ll accept it. 3 of 4 flights on time (first leg was 15 Minutes late). Golden Lounges in KLIA are fabulous.
