Slept overnight in their Quiet Area. They have discontinued their subscription on Supersport disallowing access to most important sports events on their TVs. Noddle shop is a hit! Transit in PNH was very easy and I could pass in 3 Minutes just showing BPs and go through a security screening. The Plaza Premium is a fine, 3rd part lounge that Oneworld Airlines contract to. Extremely many Chinese citizens in the lounge, likely more than 75%. This is a recent development compared to 1-2 years ago. The flights were cheap and in flexible D-class (business). They rendered a lot of miles and 160 tier points to my British Airways membership. IFE worked fine on individual monitors with many choices. Last leg offered no IFE. Newspapers and magazines available. Gatebridges made available for all passengers at all 8 aircraft ascends and descends which was very nice and quick. The cons with MAS are few but somehow significant: Very short check-in period in regional airports is a problem. Advise to come earlier and get BPs from the check-in team at the flight prior to the one you fly with. All aircraft were narrowbody and were from last century. No alcohol available nor served unless one fly to another continent.

Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. The worst flight of my life. The aircraft looked old and uncleaned. My food was cheap and insipid in a small snack size pack with no accompaniments. They did not give dinner when we landed in the night. The entertainment was just in the name ( again they got the cheap old TV series and movies) on styled consoles.  I thought they may like to attract people with good service, food and entertainment. How wrong I was. When I asked the cabin crew if she has any snacks for dinner, even peanuts will do, she said we have none.

When I went from Adelaide to Kuala Lumpur. The customer service from the staff was not good and on the same day, the food was not good. And while returning to Australia, for vegetarian they have no meal though it’s been ordered. While coming back to Australia my luggage was missed from Malaysia and had been delayed. Still waiting for its arrival. Very poor customer service.

route: Bangalore to Langkawi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bangalore to Langkawi via Kuala Lumpur. Entertainment system was very bad. The TV remote wasn’t working . We had to press on the TV screen very hardly and works only then. They didn’t have a wide range of movies, songs etc.  Leg room is good. Seating was the worst. Food was good but the quantity was less. Toilets were clean, headphones were good.

Penang to Kuala Lumpur. As I am short and the bag was slightly wider than the baggage compartment, I failed to squeeze it in and the bag dropped on one of the business class passengers. Dispirited, I left the bag on the empty seat next to me. The staff told me it is MAS policy that the passengers put their luggage into the baggage compartment on their own. However, her kindness and compassion surpassed the policy, made an exception to help me get the bag into the compartment. The flight was later delayed by bad weather and circled above the thunderstorms for an additional 30 minutes. Desperately needed the toilet; she saw I was extremely uncomfortable and allowed me a small kindness with concern for safety and advise to be quick as it was a little bumpy. Balancing small acts of kindness, safety and work flexibility in rigid policies/rules is sometimes tricky, but kindness precedes and should be credited i.e. not taken for granted. It really makes a positive difference to the service provided. Well done!

route: Perth to Bengaluru via Kuala Lumpur
review: Perth to Bengaluru via Kuala Lumpur. Our deepest gratitude to Malaysia Airlines for helping us in getting the connecting flight from Kuala Lumpur to India for our mother in law’s funeral. Thank you Elyanie at helpdesk in Kuala Lumpur for  compassion and understanding towards us. She listened to our situation patiently and issued us the tickets for an immediate flight. It was because of all the hard work and excellent service of the Malaysia Airlines staff from Air crew to ground staff our family got to see our beloved mother in law and say goodbye to her for the last time for which definitely 5 stars to everyone.  Kudos to you all.

Kuala Lumpur to Hong Kong. Outbound flight was delayed 1.5 hours due to weather conditions around KUL. Delay itself not the airline's fault, but there was no information given  throughout the long wait between the delay and the pushback announcements. Meal service was good, with a full bar and a separate dessert course. Primary drawback was the Boeing 738 I had on the outbound, which Malaysia Airlines uses for 1 of its 3 daily HKG flights. Think high-density seating and no adjustable headrests in Y. One thing I'll remember about the inbound leg is the two FAs on my aisle: one was green and on her first A330 flight, the other a seasoned vet with no qualms demonstrating tough love!

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. The check-in at Changi Airport was fast but the staff was not so friendly. The lounge that is using by Malaysia Airlines is SATS Premium Lounge in Singapore and they have a good selection of hot food, snacks and drinks. The boarding gate was at T2 with a short walking distance. After boarding, cabin crew offered me a hot tower and drink. The onboard service was very good as there was a local selection of food to choose from even a short 1 hour journey only. However, no hot drink served due to light turbulance. The seat was quite spacious and comfort. IEF came with larger screen and latest content throughout the flight. The cabin crew was friendly and attentive. Upon arrival in KLIA, I able to disembark quickly and have my time walking toward the baggage collection area. However, my flight baggages was delayed due to some technical issue. Overall, MAS was a pretty good premium product with Malaysian hospitality. More room to be improve.

Adelaide to Kuala Lumpur return  in Business Class. Both flights departed and arrived late - the return trip by 90 minutes. There was no notification in the lounge in Kuala Lumpur until the last minute, necessitating two enquiries by me at the front counter, and resulting in chaos at the gate. At least the captain apologised at the beginning and end of the flight. The attendants on the way over were very pleasant and professional, on the way back a tad curt. Food and wine was of good but not stand-out quality. The seat reclines to be fully flat and was comfortable. The selection of movies was extremely limited, almost embarrassingly so, and bespeaks cost-cutting. Baggage appropriately was at the front of the carousel on both legs. The overall sense was of an airline desperately trying to be premium but with a product in line with its entertainment options - somewhat B-grade.

During my return flight from Bangkok to Kuala Lumpur, the check-in and boarding was smooth but unfortunately, when I step into the aircraft, I was so disappointed with the cabin due to old type of B737 without IFE. The cabin was looking tired and rundown same goes with the cabin crew. Why is MAS still putting on such old aircraft on its international route and definitely will give a bad impression from the customers. You wouldn't know which aircraft you will be flying until the moment you step into the cabin. It doesnt match the money value that customer was paying for.

Bangkok to Kuala Lumpur. The check-in counter only open 2 hours before departure hour and it has been quite a rush for me. One of the group checking has been blocking some of the counter due to some issue but I think the ground staff should have handle it well. On the the other hand, it was an aircraft upgrade from B737 to A330. So i get to board on a bigger plane happily. However, thing doesn't turned out good, one of the male cabin crew attitude was bad in his mood. His service was not professional.  However, the entire flight was within my expectation and it could be better.

route: Hong Kong to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hong Kong to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. The good thing about Malaysia Airlines is that prices are fairly reasonable and it remains that way even till two to three days before departure, as long as there is availability of course, which makes last minute flying with them great. Also, they do not quite charge a premium on one-way tickets (i.e. The cost of a one way ticket is approximately half the cost of a return ticket), so it really helps when flying multiple destinations. Other than that, it is quite an average airline with average legroom, below-average food, service, average IFE, etc. Their fleet is rather dated and they tend to use more narrowbodies, but if you're lucky you might get their A350, A330 or A380. This certainly isn't my first time flying with them, and they're a barely-meeting-expectations airline on the whole. That said, Kuala Lumpur is a relatively easy airport to transit around, and their on-time performance is fairly decent. I appreciate and would recommend them for their flexibility especially for a last-minute traveler around Asia.

route: Denpasar to Colombo via Kuala Lumpur
review: Denpasar to Colombo via Kuala Lumpur. Poor food and broken entertainment system on the first stretch and very small uncomfortable business class seat on the 2nd.  Falling almost out side ways and wide as economic.  Re-scheduling is a dramatic experience,disconnected 4 times - then to find out after half an hour they easily refer you to the travel agent who refers me to them. In the end I fly with Malaysia Airlines and the ticket is with them, they are responsible for the trip and refer me back to traveloka.

Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne. I requested for sandwiches and bananas for my meals due to my low FODMAP diet. I was served 2 sandwiches and 2 bananas for dinner and one sandwich for breakfast. The bread rolls used for the sandwiches were dry and crumbly. I didn't have any issue with food from Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. Perhaps, MAS should check with the caterer to ensure that they don't provide stale bread. I will have to think thrice before I fly MAS again.

Kuala Lumpur to Manila. This is the worst customer service company. Anyway booked my flight and then said I had one suitcase to be checked. Not sure if it was Malaysia Airlines website or the slow internet to blame. The point is they charged me double for the flight. They said I booked two suitcases.  I called them immediately and said please fix this, she said I only booked one suitcase. I received an email saying they were charging for two suitcases. I went to the airport the day before my flight. I was there for two hours trying to get this resolved. I refuse to pay $250.00 for an extra bag that I don't have. It has been 13 days and not a word from them. I just called Malaysia Airlines and they say I have to pay.

Very disappointed in this airline. Booked a seat upgrade directly with them for three people. Arrived at the airport only to find they didn't reserve my seats so lost the upgrade and had to pay standard economy. now they refuse to refund me as they say I cancelled the upgrade. They have no email stating I did and cannot prove it.

route: London to Perth via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Perth via Kuala Lumpur. The food on plane was not very good from LHR to KL I had to send my food back, I had ordered from chef on board the lamb was not cooked enough. They did bring something else but not the same standard as other business class flights I have done. Seats from LHR were great but from LHR to Perth very narrow and not worth paying the extra. Wouldn’t fly with them again, overall very disappointing.

route: Melbourne to Manila via Kuala Lumpur
review: Melbourne to Manila via Kuala Lumpur. 1st time flying MH. Overnight meal service was nowhere near CX though breakfast was ok, same with the inbound. Dinner is ok but breakfast is tiny, the regional 737 service was consistent. IFE is not as good as QF and CX, very slow response. Will fly them again next time as fares are pretty good.

route: Bangalore to Melbourne via Kaula Lampur
review: My parents travelled from Bangalore to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. On the flight from KL to Melbourne they were seated at seat 22A and 22C and they were given 1 meal, when I had contacted the call centre on 22 Oct and confirmed that they will be given 2 hindu veg meal. When my father questioned the cabin crew they  said that we have only booked for 1 meal. When I was trying to do the online check in for my parents, on the flight from KL to Melbourne they were given seats one beside the other, my mother was given 22c and my father 23C when I try to change the seat it said 22A is a seat which will incur extra cost. I wanted to check the price and changed it, however I did not confirm the seat. As soon as I changed my father's seat from 23C to 22A, 23C became a cost incurring seat.  This is the last time I will book a ticket for my family members and I will not travel on Malaysia airlines.

route: Mumbai to Shanghai via Kuala Lumpur
review: I have flown with all major airlines but this was my first time flying with Malaysia Airlines from Mumbai via Kuala Lumpur. I found the cabin service was extremely poor. I had to ask twice most of the time to get a bottle of water or a glass of wine. I could not remember any smiling face from cabin crew throughout the entire trip. The crew was lazy and inattentive. Food selection was limited with poor quality. Our flight was delayed and I missed my connecting flight by approximately 10 min. I was hoping that they could wait for me but only to be given the boarding pass for a subsequent flight which was almost 12 hours later! Because of the delay, I had to cancel all my engagements in Shanghai for the day. Thanks to their poor service and complete lack of compassion to their customers, I cannot fulfill the purpose of this international trip of mine. I will try to avoid this airline as much as I can in the future.
Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. I love everything about this flight. Everything was so easy. I had the best meals on this flight and the crew were amazing. I will fly with them again.

Penang to Kuala Lumpur. They have an insane baggage policy that can trick you into having zero baggage allowance. I have an Economy Class ticket. But Malaysia air has three levels of Economy Class, and of you bought your ticket through Expedia etc, you have an Economy Lite ticket, with no baggage allowance. My $50 flight from PEN to KUL just added a $100 baggage fee for a 20kg bag.

route: Auckland to Tokyo Narita via Kuala Lumpur
review: Auckland to Tokyo Narita via Kuala Lumpur. AKL-KUL A330-200 With a 2-4-2 seat configuration it was perfect for 2 people traveling together. The seating had less legroom than the A350 but having an aisle seat alleviates the issue some what. Beer and peanuts immediately after take-off which is a nice touch, and then straight into meal service which was decent for an economy meal with more beer to boot. Good range of recent movies to watch, and a USB port to charge your devices. KUL-NRT A350-900 On-board wifi is shoddy at best, and definitely not worth the price. Flight had more legroom and better recline making for a somewhat better (attempt at) sleep. On the flight back however my entertainment screen only showed audio options when other passengers had movies fine. I had stuff downloaded on my phone so this was no issue, however buyer beware. (I wasn't the only one too).

route: Sydney to Kansai via Kuala Lumpur
review: Sydney to Kansai via Kuala Lumpur. I was a little hesitant to fly Malaysian Airlines to start with but the price point was too good to refuse. The airline uses the Qantas Business Lounge in SYD was disappointing, food options were lacking and the decor was poor, needs a serious update. The satellite lounge in KUL however was great and am looking forward to spending 5hrs there on the way home. Now on to the seat and service, if you can get a throne seat or if traveling as a couple the middle seats then I don’t think you will disappointed. Service was great, the Satay’s amazing and well the food was better then I hoped for (my partner used the book the chef option and I think I am cancelling that for the way home). They aren’t at the level of an Emirates or a Qatar but for the price I paid I can’t say a bad thing.

route: Jakarta to Saigon via Kuaka Lumpur
review: Jakarta to Saigon via Kuaka Lumpur. Came to Jakarta by Sri Lankan and continued to Saigon with Malaysia Airlines over Kuala Lumpur where I spent the night in their Golden lounge to catch next morning 1st flight to Saigon. Smooth transit in Jakarta as I had checked in Online. Long walks in T3, about 3 km in total. They use Plaza Premium Lounge i T3: Nice lounge with panorama views in 3 directions. They use old B737 narrow-body aircraft. Both flights were on time and food was also very good with 3-4 options, though I had special meal which was nice. They have never failed to bring me my special meal which must be logistically difficult. Onboard, FAs were neat and fresh, however no wines or spirits, not even a beer can be offered yet. That small privilege was removed after the MH370 incident. However, 202 USD for 4 legs pampered with extra luggage, special meal and 4 times lounge accesses (thru FFP status) is extremely good value for money. No mileage given for Q-booking class but that is the compromise. I have had some 50+ regional flights with MH over the last 5 years and must say that I have never had serious delays or luggage delivery problems. Clear information provided, even if there should arise a delay of 10 Minutes. At times they managed to prepone my departure according to my wish (arrived in airport from transit far too early) without costs. That’s how a company should run. Another strength is the hospitable and fresh staff onboard and as well in their lounges. They only need to update and align their alcohol policy and then start to renew their regional fleet as they are about to be worn out. The strength with these ageing B737 is, however, that they have so many aircrafts enabling them to instate another quickly which is a huge joker card to keep things running should there be a technical problem.

Kuala Lumpur to Langkawi Island. I paid extra for baggage but when I arrived they said they changed the policy meaning that I had to pay more for baggage. That wasn’t a very good start to my trip to Langkawi. Getting to the gate was easy and efficient. Boarding was quick and good, cabin crew were welcoming me very politely. No headrest, legroom is ok, no TV or ceiling dropping TV. No WiFi connectivity whatsoever. What am I complaining about? It’s a 50 min flight! Takeoff was good. Landing was okay. Very good flight overall. They only served salted nuts which were very yummy. Would fly with Malaysia Airlines again.

Shanghai to Kuala Lumpur. Only three checkin counters at Shanghai. Boarding was quick and efficient. Seats were pretty comfortable. But some things turned yellowish. Entertainment was ok. No inflight games but some movies and tv shows. No WiFi whatsoever. Really recommend it.

route: Delhi to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: Delhi to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur. We booked our trip as including air flights but decided to pay extra to have some leg room. Going there was fine but on our way back they had also sold our leg room seats to another party. The second leg from Kuala Lumpur to Sydney worked out as we complained at the airport and we got other seats, but the first leg from Delhi to Kuala Lumpur was bad. The day after we returned I phoned to complain and they said they would attend to it but nothing happened. I called a week later and they told me I had been refunded but there was nothing in my bank account. I called another week later to be told somebody would call me, nothing happened. I called again today, a week later to be told I had been refunded but it takes 6 to 8 weeks for the payment to happen. I consider sale of the same ticket to 2 parties unacceptable plus the wait (if you can believe them) of 6 to 8 weeks ridiculous plus the fact that they never contacted me very rude If possible.

Flew Kuala Lumpur to Penang with Malaysia Airlines. Very surprised at the very cheap price. The flight only takes less than 1 hour. Efficient check-in, friendly cabin crew and on-time flights. I highly recommend this airline.

My check-in process was seamless. The ground staff and cabin crew were very friendly and professional in performing their duties. The flight also took off on-time. As for their in-flight entertainment (IFE), it's kind of a hit-or-miss, especially when you are flying with their 737s. My first flight (9M-FFF) had no IFE screen, but my return flight (9M-MSB) had it even though both are Boeing 737-800. In any case, the touchscreen of the IFE had a noticeable lag when you interact with it. Forget smartphone-like responsiveness on the touchscreen, I felt like I had to wait for a few seconds before the screen registered my presses. Fortunately, the IFE content had a huge library to choose from. As for the food quality, it's not bad but it's not great either. Let's just say I've had much better in-flight meals in other airlines before.

Denpasar to Kuala Lumpur. It was a delay of flight MH 866 on the 23rd of August for 13 hours. As a result I with my family (two small children) missed a flight to Almaty on 23rd August and had to re-booked the flight in a two days. For two days I booked a hotel in KL. No one from Malaysia Airlines helped us. No compensation and even apologizes at that time. Rude lady at the Malaysia airlines desk at the airport shouted at me to go away and decide problems by ourselves. This was unknown country and I was stressed because of this situation. Never use these airlines!

route: Manila to Ho Chi Minh City via Kuala Lumpur
review: Manila to Ho Chi Minh City via Kuala Lumpur. I admit KLIA was in a mess this day but Malaysia Airlines has been uncapable to print a boarding pass, I had lot of difficulties to find internet access and make an online check in it was ridiculous. Malaysia Airlines lost my luggage and took 3 days to find it and send it back to me in bag conditions.  Their Customer Service was really bad, not even a phone call or support provided. I had to take another flight to Singapore after 2 days.

route: Ho Chi Minh City to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur
review: 30-31 Aug 2019 Saigon-Kuala Lumpur-Jakarta on their favorite aircrafts, the aged B737s. Allowed to check in online and checked-in very early in Saigon as they have open counters almost throughout the day. They operate 3-5 flights from Saigon per day. Got both two Boarding Passes issued instantly. The luggage was checked in for my next 4 legs (I had 6 to come, but they failed to manage the last two - but acceptable. As a frequent traveler I accessed Le Saigonnais lounge in Saigon and Golden Lounge in the Satellite terminal in KLIA. Both lounges are very good and hospitable. Nap area in Golden Lounge is very useful for me, I also appreciate their noodle section. Flights on time and well announced. Hot meals on board on both flights, and my special meal request was honored. Meals loaded from KLIA are always much better than those loaded from Ho Chi Minh. IFE worked fine. On both flights, I was given option to chose any seat available in economy. No mileage give as the ticket was cheap providing very high value for money especially elite travelers as the lounges make up for what may be missing on the flights. They give 45 kg. luggage allowances to One-World frequent flyers on a strongly discounted fare, that’s a gift. Still, they don’t serve any alcoholic drinks on those route, which is a shortcoming.

route: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur. Oh Malaysia Airlines, why can't you be like McDonald's and offer the same standard on all routes. A350-900 from LHR to KUL is fantastic. Great plane, great lounges, great staff. Why on earth would you continue to sell the dreadful experience of A330-200 business class between KUL and AKL? It's awful. Whoever designed those hideous little BC pods clearly had no intention of staying in one for more than 4 hrs. I felt sorry for the cabin crew - who were great - they don't even have somewhere to rest and appear to hate those planes too. Some of the meals on KUL-AKL were a bit rubbish I'd also have to say (fish was pretty unpleasant) Seriously Malaysia Airlines, you need to pull those A330's, they are poor and I am actually willing to pay a little more to go with Cathay, Qatar, Emirates or Singapore just to avoid those awful seats. No storage space whatsoever, they are 'open plan' into the aisle and the bed tapers at the foot so you almost have to have your feet crossed all the time. An appalling design which is better than EC, but a far cry for usual BC standards. I want to love you Malaysian, and I do, but there are loads of competitors on this route, please scrap the A330's and lease some good planes. The A350 is great.

route: Kualanamu to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur
review: Kualanamu to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur. The worst full service airline in the region. First, long delay. Second, ground staff and flight attendant were rude to me. The inflight entertainment is outdated.

Kuala Lumpur to Melbourne two years ago, in August 2017. An excellent flight with Malaysia Airlines. Check in at KLIA very smooth and quick and was able to spend time in the "new" MAS Lounge which is very spacious and an excellent selection of Western and Asian cuisine. Boarding was reasonably efficient though main security check is done at the boarding gate but 3 lanes were open so not much of a delay. Seat 4 A in Business, which is a standard Business Class seat with direct aisle access. Offered a pre take off juice and a cold towel. Departure slightly delayed however crew offered more juice when requested. After take off Tea or coffee trolley brought around as it was a morning flight and then an excellent breakfast of Muesli, fresh fruit and toast. Soon after lunch orders were taken which I declined as I was quite full after the breakfast, however the cabin crew said I could order anytime which I thought was very good. Watched a movie and a doze in the seat for a while and then they asked if I would like to something to eat and had a meat pie with tomato sauce. Prior to landing the famous Satay was served along with a glass of champagne and we landed about 15 minutes early into Melbourne. Overall with the friendly staff and the seating etc it was a most wonderful flight!

route: Hanoi to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hanoi to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur. Really disappointed with Malaysia Airlines. No notification received on potential 7h flight delay (from initial 1pm to 8pm). Compensation was not really taken care in terms of timing and service. Further delay in my following flight up to 3h delay without any compensation Cabin baggage is horrible as it seems no policy on baggage size thus make passenger with proper baggage size had to be sacrificed. My luggage was left in KL! First time using Malaysia Airlines and shall be my last time. Not recommended airline for sure.

London to Kuala Lumpur with Malaysia Airlines. I find it difficult to report any negatives about this flight. The A350 is a fine aircraft, comfortable, roomy (I am 6ft and had knee room in the cheap seats) and offers excellent IFE with large seat back screens. Cabin crew were excellent with two choices of meals at dinner and breakfast. Aircraft cabin and toilets were kept clean and tidy throughout the flight. On time departure and arrival. Quite simply great value for money.

MH 148 from Melbourne to KL. Check in most efficient and guided to express lane for security and passport clearance. MAS use the Qantas lounge which is a bunker at Melbourne but nice food and drinks on offer. Slight boarding delay as some passengers were paged by the gate staff on a number of times. Upon boarding shown to my seat in 6 A and assured by the excellent cabin manager that my "book the cook" meal was on board. Welcome drink offered however no champagne. I asked for a glass if possible and it was delivered in a prompt manner. After take off a cold towel was handed out and then one of the highlights of this airline the satay was served! Next came a Terrine as a starter followed by my lunch which I had pre ordered. A prawn and noodle dish which was one of the best meals I have enjoyed in over 40 years of flying internationally! The wine list was very good and also the "if your hungry" menu was also great! The service and the staff on board were brilliant and answered the call button within seconds. Movies were limited but enough to keep me going for the 8 hour flight. Overall for the price and the great crew this flight I rate in my top 3 of all time.

route: Delhi to Adelaide via Kuala Lumpur
review: My elderly parents traveled from Delhi to Adelaide via Kuala Lumpur. I mentioned wheelchairs while booking tickets and it was printed on the ticket too. At Delhi Airport, only my mother-in-law was given the wheelchair initially. The staff kept on insisting that my father-in-law doesn't need a wheelchair. My FIL looks fit but he has diabetes and he cant walk for long. My FIL had to give the staff 200 rs to the staff to get wheelchair service. Their ordeal didn't end here. After reaching Kulla Lumpur, no one came to escort my parents in wheelchair. They asked the crew to which they received the reply that they themselves had to change the flight. They had to walk to the next gate and board the next flight. Even after reaching Adelaide, my parents had to stand in the queue for immigration check for 3 hours as the airport was busy. They were not offered a wheelchair at any time. I hope you understand how difficult it is for elderly and physically unfit parents to travel so far. Shame on you Malaysia Airlines for treating your customers this way. I hope you will take some action.

Kuala Lumpur to London. After slating the A330-200, top marks to Malaysia Airlines for the A350. You would think it was an entirely different airline. As good a business class as you can get in my humble and so much of that is down to the aircraft.

London to Kuala Lumpur. Golden Lounge in Heathrow provide great view of the runway. Rice, beef and oxtail soup provided with selections of fruits and snacks. Purposely booked seat 6A as I prefer to look out of the window. Boarding for premium class is efficient through another entrance. Cabin and seat are clean. Cabin crews are attentive, friendly and efficient. Slippers are provided. Aigner amenity kit provided. Entertainment selections are sufficient although not extensive. Satay is delicious as always. I pre-ordered Braised Lamb Shank, which is tender and generous in amount. The signature drink of Wau Emas is very refreshing but has to keep reminding the flight attendant to provide stirrer stick to stir it first. Wanted to have the Nasi Lemak for breakfast but cancelled my order as I was too full. Seat is satisfactory but the leg room under the entertainment unit is a bit cramped. Unable to bend my knees as they will knock on the entertainment unit. An uneventful and satisfactory flight.

Kuala Lumpur to Seoul. I put in a bid to upgrade to business class for a trip on 4th August, and when my bid was accepted I wanted to cancel.  I contacted the Reservations department by phone, they told me there's no phone number for the MH upgrade department. How convenient.

route: Chennai to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: Chennai to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur. I was sick when I boarded the flight. I requested the cabin crew about this and asked for medicine and hot water. They initially denied the request as they were really busy serving food. However, they didn't provide me with enough amenities such as blankets, hot water or medicine. Only positives would be the flight route, it was one of the fastest flight i have ever traveled (9 hrs 50 mins app) from KUL to AKL. Kindly update your movies section that is way outdated.

route: Taipei to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur
review: Taipei to Jakarta via Kuala Lumpur. Great Value! Delicious food, i really enjoy the nasi lemak! Great flight attendant, especially the one that service us, he is very nice and very helpful. Thank you for the great experience of this flight.

route: Penang to Hong Kong via Kuala Lumpur
review: Penang to Hong Kong via Kuala Lumpur. Took four international and domestic flights with MH in July 2019: HAN-KUL-PEN and PEN-KUL-HKG, all sectors on a B738. The onboard service has been good to excellent on all these flights (i.e. the cabin crews very cooperative and approachable) and the food well-presented. The highlight of all these sectors was MH432 KUL to HKG on 30th July where the onboard service, food presentation and general guest experience exceeded all expectations: a sumptuous satay to begin with followed by a well-presented hot meal and ice cream. The Bruno Paillard as well as the Philip Shaw Chardonnay beautifully accompanied the meals on these international sectors - Malaysian Hospitality at its best, indeed. MH is still great in the air for us but, over many domestic and international flights for the past 15 years, we've become somewhat frustrated with the constant delays experienced with MH on their intra-Asian flights - we always check MH first - also experienced this time with all four sectors (20-60 min delay each). MH needs to seriously monitor their departure procedures very carefully since they seem to take such a long time in getting a flight ready even when all passengers have boarded and the luggagge has been uploaded. Still, it takes a mysterious 10-30 minutes to get a flight ready and shut the doors. Having learned this over the years, we always take MH international & domestic connections allowing us at least 2 hours at KLIA in our attempts to guarantee peace of mind. Some inefficiency is clearly there in the departure proceedings, be it domestic or international, and they haven't been able to tackle this operational problem over the years. The delays on these four sectors didn't bother us since we knew what to expect, however, we advise MH passengers not to trust too tight connections (i.e. 45 min up to 90 min) since these may simply not work out at KLIA. Otherwise, Malaysia Airlines is still good in the air with pleasant staff, tasty food and good service by a dedicated crew. Will surely fly again.

I have flown with Malaysia Airlines for 3 times previously from Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta on Nov 2018, Kuala Lumpur to Hong Kong on February 2019 & the latest flown with Malaysia Airlines was 9th July 2019 from Kuala Lumpur to Taipei. Overall what can I say is good. Cabin Crew was nice to all Passengers. Seat was comfortable even though got some scratch on seat. Food is okay but for me need more improvement.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore with Malaysia Airlines. Stay away! There is absolutely no reason for one to pay for such a rude and impolite experience. This airline should have been bust multiple times already. As a weekly traveller I never in my life experienced such a rude, lazy and ufriendly staff. They should be deeply ashamed. Besides that maintenance of the cabins is zero. Everything is dirty and old. On all their routes there are more than enough alternatives.

I've flown with Malaysia Airlines multiple times, both on economy and business. While business class experience is always great, this is the first time I felt compelled to comment on great service in economy. I flew on MH2 from KUL-LHR on 20th July, on the new A350, which had relatively comfortable seats, the screen was good (although movie selection not so great). The food was so-so. What I want to comment on is how GREAT the cabin crew were. There was one standout gentleman (serving the aisles at the back of the cabin), who was an absolute pleasure, but in general the whole crew were genial professional and service was great. I hope more MH flights will ensure for quality service such as this.

Kuala Lumpur to Manila. Overall good, especially the cabin crew which provided a very professional service. but, there is only one thing that I hope they can be improve which is their IFE system, the touch screen was very slow response.

Kuala Lumpur to Sydney. The ground staff is not polite at all. She was not rude but a smile couldn't hurt anyone. Not a single smile from her. She was very robotic and I felt being quickly ushered away. Then comes the cabin staff, I am baffled with the responses given by them. I asked nicely for another cup of orange juice. Instead of telling me nicely that he would serve me in a while, he told me "Wait for the 2nd round, be patient". Long gone has the so-called Malaysian hospitality.

Sibu to Kuala Lumpur. Always a pleasure flying with Malaysia Airlines. Airticket was very affordable - even cheaper than the low-cost competitor. Check in was done online but it's a shame that they do not let you choose your own seat on the flight (no other seat options available). However, ground staff at KUL was quite unpleasant, with most of them looking really moody and unhelpful. Cabin crews were extremely pleasant otherwise, helpful and attentive with a smile on their face always. Narrowbody jets are used for their domestic/regional flights. Seat pitch slightly tight for a 185cm guy like me but otherwise acceptable for a 2 hours flight. Food was alright. Overall a great flight.

Kuala Lumpur to Auckland. I arrived at KUL at 2PM on 20th June from Sri Lanka expecting to fly to Auckland at 11.25pm. All my plans got shattered from the moment I heard that the flight scheduled to leave at 1130PM will be delayed by about 8 hours. Delays can happen but there has to be a proper way to handle these things. I was asked to go to a hotel with food vouchers but immigration officers rejected to allow us to go out due to err on the boarding pass. Several times I went here and there without any meaning wasting my time.  So there has to be a proper mechanism to handle those frustrated customers without asking them to go here and there and wasting time. As I missed both my domestic connecting flights from AKL and CHC, had to purchase new tickets due to this delay.

Travelled from New Delhi to Kuala Lumpur and back for a vacation in June 2019. The outbound trip on MH 191 was just okay but on the return trip on MH 190 the service was horrible and staff was rude. There was no drinks service and the air hostess just said you will have to wait as I am the only one serving this section (how is that my problem). There were no headphones available and on requesting for a set they were provided grudgingly to just me and the other passengers were told to wait for the flight to take off. Me and my son were not served the peanuts or snack which was randomly given. No tea or coffee was offered. On a five hour flight it is usual for the staff to walk around with a tray of water and juice. Service standards were very disappointing as compared to other airlines.

route: London Heathrow to Kuching via Kuala Lumpur
review: London Heathrow to Kuching via Kuala Lumpur. My journey starts early as the flight departs at 9am. My check-in procedure went pretty smooth and we all boarded the plane. The cabin crew was friendly and engaging and welcoming. As I travel far to east Malaysia. I had to transit in KLIA for 2 hours. As our flight got delayed 45mins in Heathrow, our arrival in Malaysia got affected. So I had to run (like marathon) to the main terminal (dosmetic). The line at immigration was ridiculous and little did I know the boarding time to Kuching has already started. I made it after 20 mins at the imigration and was able to run to A8. I was tired, sweating and scared. As I reached the gate, the gate staff was very angry at me because I was late. This what she said "What took you so long, why don't you reach here early, the passengers are so unhappy with you". Can you imagine, she said this thing to you and the passengers listened to the drama. Malaysia Airlines, please keep your professionalism, your Malaysian hospitality. I'm traumatized with the incident. because I didnt do anything wrong. The gate people have rejected my boarding pass. I don't mind to wait extra but not to be humiliated by the staff.

Kuala Lumpur to Perth. I left my iPad on the side storage sleeve during flight and sure enough left that behind when disembarking at 2 in the morning. Assisted by the concierge of the hotel i stayed in their call to airport Lost & Found yielded a "nothing found". I kept my faith in the efficiency of MH business class and the fact that the stewardess in-charge of my row  has been one of the more experienced flight attendants I have come across and of course the in-flight manager who impressed me as a veteran in his class. As I was returning to KUL just the next day on MH126 (return leg of daily 127) all I did was to enquire again at check in counter and sure enough, my iPad was duly returned in good and proper state.  Thank you MH crew on both 127 (19 June) and 126 (21 June), for the pleasant and trustworthy flights.

Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. Upon entering the plane, Air hostess was so rude. Rather than greeting passenger she started yelling on me saying that can you reposition your baggage. My husband was standing in an aisle 4-5 steps away from our seat and I requested if he can do this in a minute. She arrogantly reacted that I need to do it now. Shame on such a staff.  Hope we can have better experience after take off from Melbourne

Kuala Lumpur to Jakarta. Kudos to MAS crew. Top notch service. Quality at its best. Just maybe need to improve a bit on their food. Other than that, you can't ask for more. Keep improving MAS! You'll be back where you belong, the best in the world.

route: Jakarta to Johor Bahru via Kuala Lumpur
review: On my last flight when returning from Johor Bahru to Jakarta my flight cancelled and rescheduled for 4 hours from the previous schedule, this made me bother because of the trip from Jakarta to Bogor (where I live) quite far, so it takes more time and will get worse in the evening (after office hour).

I recently flown with Malaysian Airlines from Phnom Penh to Kuala Lumpur and I had an amazing flight. Check-in at PNH was easy and quick, boarding was organised and flight departed on time. Although it is an old cabin design, it was a comfortable flight and legroom was sufficient. They offered complimentary meal and beverages on this flight. After take off passengers were offered soft drinks and peanuts followed by meal tray service consist of salad, main meal and dessert. I must say for a short haul flight it was a good service and the food was tasty. The announcement made by the flight was clear and informative. What I like the most is the announcement made to welcome Malaysian passengers home after we touched down at KLIA was indeed very special with a message. This message made every Malaysian who live abroad feel special and welcome home. I would definitely fly with Malaysia Airlines again.

route: London to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur. I used to always choose to fly with Malaysia Air, however not after this trip. I was flying by myself with my infant daughter, and it took 3 phone calls and 2 hours of my time to try establish that I was not able to purchase extra leg room because of travelling with my child. I purchase lounge access whilst in Kuala Lumper as they advertise having a family & child friendly space - having a room with no doors or toys is not a family friendly space. What tipped it all over the edge was that my new Samsonite suitcase has been broken - the external grip has been snapped off and rendered my suitcase unusable - however Malaysia Air claim that this is not their responsibility. Absolutely appalling customer service.

The seats are too tight together that I felt the guy's knee against the back of my seat. The cabin crew was unhelpful - they can't lend me a pen and just replied "we don't provide pen". When asked if there was additional food in between 2 small inflight meals, they say no. Malaysia Airlines used to have amazing crew 20 years back. Not anymore. It's heading downhill rapidly.

London to Kuala Lumpur. The check-in in London was very slow at their jobs. When we came on-board the A350, we were shocked there was a lack of staff to greet us. We were skipped when they were handing out drinks. I found the food was disgusting. We have flown Malaysia Airlines for so long, and have always remained loyal. This was the worst experience. Despite all this, the aircraft was very nice, so extra points.

route: Bangalore to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bangalore to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur. This has to be one of the worst airlines I’ve flown with. Seating arrangements are cramped, very poor inflight service, the food was soggy inedible mash, the steward refused to supply water to me. To top it off there’s been wilful failure to allocate my frequent flyer points without repeated follow ups. In fact on the last point I’m still waiting. I’ve made 3 phone calls, and I’ve written 3 emails. None of the emails have been answered. Staff assure me the flights were eligible for points and that it’s a computer generated error. Despite this, the error is still not fixed. If they apply the same duplicity to their technical operations I can see why they planes are so unsafe and keep on dropping out of the sky.

route: London to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Denpasar via Kuala Lumpur. I’ve flown with Malaysia Airlines on many occasions for the past 35 years. I was loyal to the airline as I was born in Malaysia. The level of service has deteriorated to the point where Malaysia Airlines should be called a glorified budget airline at a premium price. I’ve flown on 10 separate occasions with MH, both domestic and international in the past 13 months. The cabin crew were sullen, curt and unfriendly and treated the passengers like a necessary evil. Food was average to poor. The tray was dirty and the plane was dated. There’s nothing to crow about KL airport.  Whatever happened to Malaysian hospitality? Never again.

I travelled from Jakarta to Kuala Lumpur. Onboard the flight I requested vegetarian food the cabin crew told there was no vegetarian food instead of that he provided few biscuits packets. After I refused that I did not get served soft drinks or coffee.

I was traveling Kuala Lumpur to Senai. The customer service I received at the counter is the worse service I had received from a ground staff. She showing attitude to me as a passenger.  During boarding some of the staff did not greet with sincere smile. Request to fill in water was rejected at the first place which made me pretty upset.

route: Delhi to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur
review: Delhi to Melbourne via Kuala Lumpur. Very poor service. Booked with Bassinet which was denied. Very rude and unprofessional ground staff in New Delhi. Customer service representative responded that could not do anything.

route: Bangkok to Tawau via Kuala Lumpur
review: Bangkok to Tawau via Kuala Lumpur. Got to experience both new and old aircraft. The old one had poor entertainment system. Dirty toilet and poor food on all flights. Most cabin crew were decent, a few of them were not so great. Boarding was late on every flights, but they did arrive on time.

route: Mumbai to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: On 30th April myself and my wife boarded the flight from Mumbai. The cabin attendants on MH0195 were very abrupt and had very poor customer service.  The cabin attendants were not at all attentive to the needs of the passengers.  No salutations when we left the plane. This was really appalling as when we got onto our next leg from KL to Auckland the crew were extremely courteous and friendly. However on this leg the food was very bad. The breakfast was not at all good. This is not something that we expected from Malaysian airlines which is our frequent airline. This has made us rethink and think of other options.

route: Auckland to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur
review: Auckland to Phuket via Kuala Lumpur. We flew with Malaysia Airline just this week. The seating was very uncomfortable and hardly enough room to cross your legs while seated, and I am very short. The seating is far too small for international flights. How are you meant to sleep in these conditions? The shorter flight from KL to Phuket has more leg room! Food was below average. Don`t recommend the red wine either. I would not like to fly with them again unless upgraded perhaps only then would consider flying with them again. The in-flight entertainment headphones I had on full volume but still had difficulty hearing the movie also did my partner. The noise of the plane in flight was so loud.

Kuala Lumpur to Perth. Checked in at KL sentral - very convenient! Beautiful lounge with a great selection of food. A rather long queue to enter the gate, although parents of young children need not queue. I was happy to go on the A330 instead of the 737. However, the A330 is rather old. Seat configuration is odd - seats are staggered but not really spacious. Flat bed is a plus. Good range of movies. Even though this is a night flight, no overnight pack or sleeping masks were provided. Good menu although I only got to try the satay as I slept through the flight.

route: Hong Kong to Perth via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hong Kong to Perth via Kuala Lumpur. Bigger plane were deployed this time, which made the journey much more enjoyable. Service and food were stellar! MH is trying their best to stay on top of the games, despite limited resources and profit loss. From HK to KL I had managed to secure the "Throne" seat 4K, lots of storage space and comfortable seating. From KL to Perth, they used an old A300-200 plate leased from SABENA (Already closed down), business class is like Thai airways staggered business flat bed, but very narrow and lack of storage space, all made for an average flight, but the great service and food made up for the inadequacy. Luggage transferred from HK to Perth were delivered promptly. Overall, it was a very good trip.

Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. Malaysia Airlines seemed to have changed its seat selection policy. Payment is now applicable to select even a regular seat. Now my young female child (11) and I have been placed in two separate rows in two middle seats - this is absolutely ridiculous. I saw this only at the web check in 48 hours before. Now I cant even change seats by paying, since the aircraft is shown as full!. I understand they have to charge for seat selection, but common sense should be applied.

Singapore to Kuala Lumpur. First business class flight on a Boeing 737-800. I always find Malaysia Airlines provide quality service. A short 1hr flight and the cabin crew were so attentive offering a range of beverages and meals. I chose the Curry pie which was hot and delicious. The seat was very comfortable for the short hop to KL. As they say MH is Malaysia Hospitality.

route: Mumbai to Bali via Kuala Lumpur
review: A very good journey from Mumbai to Bali via Kuala Lumpur. I flew with them this time due to convenient timings after a gap of 3-4 years after being fed up with very inconsistent service in between but this flight was a very pleasant surprise and if this is the service level then kudos for a great job done. Very good, clean and comfortable aircraft on both legs of the journey with well kept bathrooms. I paid extra for extra legroom seats and it was completely worth it. The cabin crew were very pleasant and helpful throughout the flight. The flights were exactly on time both while departing and arriving. Just a few grouses, Malaysia Airlines seems to have done away with alcohol in Economy Class, not that I miss it, but worth noting though they had quite a few soft drinks and juices available. The food from Mumbai to Kuala Lumpur was average, nothing to complain about but the breakfast in the Kuala Lumpur to Denpasar leg was really good. The only real issue was that the inflight entertainment system is rather tough to operate. But these are minor grouses, overall a big thumbs up.

Perth to Kuala Lumpur with Malaysia Airlines. Plane looks old and I could feel the person behind me constantly hitting my chair. 737s are never comfortable - even business class seats are not comfortable. A selection of juices and water was offered as pre-flight drinks but I requested champagne, which they were happy to oblige. At meal time, all courses were served at once - like in economy class, except served on cutlery. The food is delicious though - hokkien noodles live up to the Malaysian standards. Entertainment is good and we get noise cancelling headsets. Service was excellent - my champagne was topped up throughout the flight.

Kuala Lumpur to Sydney. Worst airline ever and first time being bumped off a flight because it was overbooked.  It's not fair to leave paying customers stranded with their miserable pittance compensation. The airport is located in the middle of nowhere and far away from KL CBD. How do you justify in compensating stress and inconvenience? They have lost me as a customer.

Kuala Lumpur to Bangkok. This airline has a policy where after purchasing an economy class seat, you can bid on an upgrade. I did  that and won the bid. Malaysia Airlines charged my CC immediately. However, when checking in at KL Airport, they had downgraded me with no firm reason. The assistant at the transit desk said it was because of the change of plane and in turn had less business class seats. This was incorrect. A dispute was raised, at which time they said the money will be refunded in 4 - 8 weeks. They mentioned they were refunding the money to a credit card that wasn't mine. Offering something, taking money for it, cancelling it, and then keeping the money for up to 8 weeks is somewhat unethical. Spending my valuable time in order to get my money back on an issue that is clearly their fault. Historically I have flown Malaysia Air in First, Biz Class and Economy a few years ago and I believe they were a 5 star airline at one time. They were at one time excellent. It's a shame to see how far they have fallen.

Red eye from PER-KUL on 28 April. Ground services in Perth are good, clear announcements all around. The plane was delayed and an email came through informing us of the change in departure time. I selected the extra legroom seats in front of the economy cabin which were very comfortable. Plenty of legroom and the seats were wide enough for me, and I am big. The flight eventually took off at 0250 and again, dinner service came about 30 minutes later. What is it with Malaysia Airlines and their inappropriate timing with meals? Why not just do a beverage service and serve a decent breakfast before landing? As a result, we got tiny portions of rice and curry at 3 am and nothing else afterwards. The crew were pleasant and responsive and I couldn't fault them. IFE was okay but the touch screens are not very responsive and there is no hand held device to use instead of the touch screen. Landed on time despite the delay and baggage was delivered fast. No complaints here.

route: Brisbane to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: Brisbane to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. On board the flight, I found it appalling that the staff offered me, a female travelling alone, only fruit juice as a pre-flight drink but offered males and couples alcoholic beverages. Not long after take-off, I requested a toiletry pack from the cabin-crew, as none was provided at my seat (other seats in Business Class appeared to have one) and after the staff member searched my seat area, I was told she would get me one shortly. As this was an overnight flight, I did not push my request, but asked again in the morning and was told that it was not needed as we were about to land. When I went to use the bathroom in the morning, I tried to excuse myself to get past the staff standing in the galley (complaining about another passenger who had been extremely rude to the staff) and I was spoken to very rudely and told that I should use the bathrooms in the economy area. The business class toilet was vacant and no-one and I waited 10 minutes and no-one went into the bathroom, but when I went to the galley again the staff again blocked the access and I was forced to use the economy toilet. I feel the staff’s treatment of me on this flight was judgmental and extremely rude, and displayed a level of arrogance. I work in a service industry and am always mindful of treating others as I would like to be treated – with politeness and courtesy. I passed my complaint to Malaysia Airlines but their 'customer care officer' is continuing to refuse to escalate my complaint for resolution. Appalling behaviour by in-flight crew supported by the unprofessional attitude of their, loosely termed Customer Care.

route: Kathmandu to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur
review: Kathmandu to Bangkok via Kuala Lumpur. The flight was booked about 5 months in advance. On the airport i was told that there was a technical problem and therefore if I wanted to stay a night extra. That was ok for me but not when they told me it was without compensation. They told me to wait. A bit later whey wanted to put me on another flight Malindo, again without compensation. I booked MAS for some extra comfort but they wanted my money but put me on an other aircraft. I refused since no compensation was offered. So I got my original flight, which I later regretted. The food was some of the worst I had on board. And there was no entertainment on a nearly 5 hours flight. If you want to fly budget and paying a lot MAS is the company for you, if you want service even Air Asia or Lion Air would provide you more. Don’t be fooled like me as I thought it was a better choice.

route: London to Penang via Kuala Lumpur
review: I purchased a ticket from London to Penang via Kuala Lumpur. Unfortunately my elderly family member is very ill and I had to rush back home 10 days earlier than scheduled. Ground staff were very helpful at Heathrow airport especially the manageress, she is very friendly and she kept asking her staff to help me to negotiate with the MAS head office in Kuala Lumpur to reduce my penalty charge due to unexpected issue at home. Eventually still have to pay £505 penalty charge. Feeling angry and disgusting for this so called penalty charge due to emergency case at home and not due to lateness to miss the flight and etc.

route: Phnom Penh to Saigon via Kuala Lumpur
review: From Phnom Penh to Saigon via Kuala Lumpur 3-4 April 2019 on the classic, ageing B737-800’s. They only allow for max. 2 hours check-in in Phnom Penh which is insufficient, at times chaotic, and deprives amble time for the lounge. Check-in online is waste of time as PNH airport does not accept online Boarding Passes anyway. The 3rd party lounge MH uses in PNH, Premium Plaza, is nice but food and drink offered has deteriorated compared to 2 years ago when they opened: the Bakery is dead, narrow drinks offering, noodle bar with industrialised ingredients only (e.g. fish-balls and meatballs, no unprocessed meat). Onboard, nice classic business-class seats with personalized IFE. Flights on time and luggage handled perfectly to Saigon: luggage allowance is generous, 40 kg, and was quickly delivered at destination. Have neither had serious delays nor luggage losses with an estimated now over 50 flights I have taken with Malaysian. Generous miles also rendered. I am happy to take this big detour; MH always delivers, and their lounges in KUL are top class. It’s a dry airline and even beers are banned.

route: Sydney to Dhaka via Kuala Lumpur
review: Sydney to Dhaka via Kuala Lumpur. My wife booked a ticket with Malaysia airlines for 3rd April which took off last night. While checking in and baggage drop she had extra weight both for hand luggage and main luggage. Since I was there she reduced the weight of the bags by taking out some belongings and gave it to me. Her hand luggage weighed 9 kg Which was approved by the  check in person and a tag was given too saying its fine to carry that weight. While boarding the first flight at the gate she was stopped since she had a bag pack and a camera with her. she had to throw away the bag pack  and was allowed to travel from Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. Again while boarding her 2nd flight from Kuala Lampur to Dhaka she was stopped at the gate and was said to have overweight though there was a tag of 9 kg on the hand luggage and also it was less than 9 kg now since she threw her clothes, she was not allowed to get on the plane until they forced her to pay extra.

Boarding and greeting nothing remarkable. Flight Service Director rarely seen other than boarding and arrival. Two female crew very nice but not strikingly competent. Simple requests from something like the Anytime Menu were confused. Main meal from Chef on Call menu appalling. Too tough to chew and served on a plate with sauce splattered everywhere. How basic a hospitality function is wiping splatter. PTV entertainment very ordinary. First headphones not working. Storage compartment door in seat broken. Nothing about this business class flight anything much more than an ordinary economy class experience other than the lie flat experience.

Sydney to Kuala Lumpur. Appalling service with minimal ok features on 26 Mar 19. Abrupt and unfriendly check in. Qantas lounge quite good. Boarding at 9.45pm. Lined up and made to wait 10 minutes standing like cattle in the yards. Had a throne style seat so good space and storage, noting there are only around 3 of these seats. One seat control function broken. The others are very cramped. Cabin crew appalling. Robotic. Though laughing, eating, drinking and joking happily amongst themselves in the galley. Couldnt squeeze a smile out of them. Offered acidic carton orange or apple juice or water on boarding. Then nothing for 1 hour 15 minutes when the drinks trolley entered the cabin. So slow for night flight. Then lukewarm satay and anything off the "anytime" snack menu. All ordinary. I had ordered from the "Chef on Call" menu which listed 8 supper items. It never showed. Woken an incredible 3 hours before landing. Breakfast served and asked for my choice. Then told i couldnt have it because i ordered Chef on Call. So was brought supper grilled fish fillets with mashed potato and baby carrots for breakfast. Explained this was a supper meal. Cabin crew more or less stated take it or leave it. I left it. No big deal. I would get a muffin at McD on landing. Very sweet and commited Indian flight attendant then brought a nice coffee from the rear galley. No such friendliness from the senior forward galley crew. Cold robotic crew. Just an overall appalling business class experience.

Kuching to Singapore. Never a bad time with Malaysia Airlines. Check-in counters were very efficient. Boarding was fast. Plane took off on time. Seats were typical economy class seats, no complain, adequate leg rooms (can choose exit row or 5th row @ Y Class if you want more legroom space). Food was adequate for a short regional flight. Cabin crew was top notch as usual. IFE had a wide range of movies and music to choose from. Well done Malaysia Airlines.

Kuala Lumpur to Phuket. For more than 20 years, I've never had a bad flight with Malaysia Airlines. Efficient ground staff. On-time departure and landing. Skilful pilots and good announcements. Comfortable seating. Genuinely pleasant and caring crew. Tasty snacks. Well done.

route: Melbourne to Hanoi via Kuala Lumpur
review: Melbourne to Hanoi via Kuala Lumpur. A terrible food and bad service. We travelled with 2 kids and the first trip just had very bad food. But the way back was worse than any airline experiences I have. On the way to Hanoi. The food was bad but we think maybe because of our taste is different. So i decided to buy some food on the way back. First some how they put my 6 years old kid seat alone far away from us so it leading to no meal for her! The flight attendant said "child meal is nothing, she will give us other meal!" Next 15 mins she came back and said because of the wrong seating (we did not know that she have to seat in other seat so we seated together.) So they fixed it. But yes the child meal is horrible, chocolate, sweet drink, and kind of chicken with mashed potatoes. My kid did not eat any of that just a drink. We kindly asked for a coffee, fight attendant said the airplane is go though a turbulence so they cant service the hot drink! Ok fine we understand. About 45 mins before landing. We asking again (Tthe turbulence is finished) the flight attendant said! " what for? We almost landing" then walk off! We won't travel with Malaysia Airlines again!

Kuala Lumpur to Sibu. Check in done online 48 hours prior to departure - user friendly site. Do remember to print your boarding pass at the kiosk prior to baggage drop if you are departing via KUL (KLIA). There was a queue for the baggage drop but the line cleared quickly as there were many counters open at that time. Proceed to the departure hall where I spent my waiting time at the domestic Golden Lounge. The lounge had food and drink options - no alcoholic drinks provided. No shower room available as well compared to their regional lounge. Food choices were fair and palatable, no complains. Variety could be better. Some children in the lounge were pretty noisy and that made it quite uncomfortable but the lounge had an area with a great view of the tarmac for plane-spotting. Boarding was quick and efficient too at the departure gate. The aircraft used was 9M-MXJ, a Boeing 737-8H6 used for MH domestic and regional short haul flights. Seats were leather, fairly comfortable although seat pitch could be better (I'm 1.85m tall so can be quite cramp). 2 food options for inflight meal service, food was served piping hot so it was great. MH cabin crew - cheerful and lovely as always! IFE had great choices of latest movies.

Wonderful flight with Malaysia Airlines. Boarding was very smooth, boarded by zone which is according to your seat number. The cabin crews were very friendly, always working with a smile. Flight departure was punctual. Seat was fairly comfortable. IFE came with adequate choices of movies/musics. Overall a great airline to fly with. Ticket was very cheap too.

route: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur
review: London to Auckland via Kuala Lumpur. 2 suitcases, 1 damaged, 1 lost and damaged. 4th day trying to reach customer service 2 emails and several calls with still no action from them! Food just above average, staff so-so, really depending on the person. No care whatsoever with their customers.

Travelled SGN-KUL-PNH on 5-6 March 2019 on the ageing B737. The ticket was a coup, purchased under heavy promotion from Malaysia Airlines homepage, class D, and could be changed endlessly as desired. Generous miles given. Smooth transfer in SGN to where I arrived from KUL (also on MH) in economy. They re-labelled the luggage so I avoided exiting transit. MH has in SGN changed to use the new Le Saigonnais Lounge which is a blessing and an improvement to the previous Apricot. In KUL, I had a night over in Golden Lounge (accessed to elite FFP-card by QR), which went smoothly. Malaysia Airlines delivers and make me willing to take long detours when the price is tempting. Largest weakness is lack of any booze on regional and domestic flights. This is accentuated by the ageing fleet of noisy B737 equipped with unpredictable configuration and refurbishment. IFE is often completely lacking on these aircrafts. However, according to price paid and punctuality they are a great deal and a rising company.

route: Jakarta to Ho Chi Minh via Kuala Lumpur
review: Jakarta to Ho Chi Minh via Kuala Lumpur on 2 separate tickets 4th and 5th March 2019. Old aircrafts B737. Flights on time, boarding smooth, FAs adept. Special meal (SFML) preordered for free and given out smoothly to perfection. No beer nor sparkling water in economy class. Otherwise, everything went well, luggage and transfers handled to perfection. In CGK, they use Plaza Premium new lounge in T3, a nice breeze overlooking the tarmac. In KLIA their Golden Lounges are a breeze and faultless. I spent a night in transit there at sleepers’ area without hassle. FFP-miles granted correctly though I am in the process of changing FFP from QR to BA. Tickets very cheap. All benefits from being an elite flyer granted.

A very pleasant flight from Singapore to Indonesia, FAs were attentive, friendly and helpful and the food was excellent. Cabin crew very friendly good smiles and helpful. Toilets clean very comfortable seat in economy class with AVOD and nice entertainment system. Good job Malaysia Airlines. I really hope MH will be back on top again. What happened to them was very unfortunate and not their fault.

route: Kuala Lumpur to Kota Kinabalu via Lahad Datu
review: I am Malaysian and I love my country, thus my support for the country's premier airline, flying frequently (monthly) between Sabah and Kuala Lumpur for work. The uniform and the MAS logo brings good memories when MAS was actually good and was one of the best airlines in the world. However, it is disheartening to see that our national airline's standard has deteriorated over the years. From old and worn-out planes, dysfunctional inflight entertainment, bad quality food, and the worst of all, unfriendly and unhelpful staff. On my recent flight there was a stewardess who was in such a bad temper, she was almost throwing the in flight meals at us. That was the straw that broke the camel's back. I'm not a demanding person and I've flown with many airlines to be able to see the difference. Work is busy and I wouldn't have written in if it were just a one time disappointment or isolated incident. While others strive to provide unfailingly good service, MAS has excelled in providing consistently poor service. If you have a choice, and you treasure a pleasant flight experience, choose another airline.

Melbourne to Kuala Lumpur. I had purchased a last minute upgrade to business at the check in counter where I was informed that infants cannot be upgraded, but it is just an issue within the system and there would be no issue with my baby seating with me, it is just for the processing for the ticket. Upon embarking the plane, the flight attendant told me he couldn’t seat with me. The initial counter staff then got on the plane and dismissed their initial statements saying they could sit with me. They also told me it was just during the take off he couldn’t sit with me but the flight attendants refused? Which ended up with me sitting in economy. The counter staff and flight attendants also fed me misinformation such as the captain could make a decision on where we could seat but this was not true. They are refusing to refund the money we paid for the upgrade.

route: Brisbane to Tokyo via Kuala Lumpur
review: Brisbane to Tokyo via Kuala Lumpur. Overall the flight was quite pleasant. Food was adequate, and there was a normal amount of leg room. Unfortunately on our return flight we ran into some problems where our trains to the airport were hours late. Subsequently we missed our flight and were left out to dry by the Malaysia Airlines staff. A one and a half hour delay caused us to be 10 minutes late to check in (1 hour before departure). The staff did not help us find another flight and after searching online we found that we essentially had to pay a fee equivalent to the price of our entire return trip from Australia for missing our flight if we wanted to rebook. On top of this we would have to pay the difference between our original flight and the rebooked flight which looked like double four times the original price. Overall probably would have been fine with the experience if we didn't have to go through the difficult situation of rescheduling flights. Customer service was almost no help and they were not transparent about how they calculated these extra fees and last minute prices. Malaysia Airlines were one of the cheapest options but honestly after this they may not be worth it. Flights are often very time specific and taken in potentially stressful situations so in the future I would recommend just paying the little bit extra to use a more reliable airline with a better reputation.

Early morning departure from London to Kuala Lumpur. Business class seat was amazing. Cabin crew have a good attitude, world class service and great hospitality. I bought a last minute ticket with this airline and they still giving me their level best of service to me. Food was amazing. A lot of beverages and Choices. Seat was clean and tidy. Clear announcement made by captain and feel safe with them in this flight.
Kuala Lumpur to Tawau. Baggage drop took an hour plus because only 2 counters were open. Luggage delayed for 7 hours and scratches everywhere on my luggage. Bad handling of luggage.

Malaysia Airlines is currently flying its A350-900 between Sydney and Kuala Lumpur. This is my first time flying A350 so I am really excited to experience the new aircraft and Malaysia Airlines business class. At Sydney T1 there are priority lanes for Business Suites and Business passengers, as well as Enrich Platinum, Gold and Silver members. Business class passengers receive 40kg of check-in luggage, but also an express boarding voucher to skip the queue through immigration at Sydney Airport. This definitely comes in handy, especially at Sydney Airport. At the gate, there is no announcement made and the signs for priority passengers are not made clear too. However, once onboard the plane, the cabin crew truly shines, and they live and breath the Malaysian Hospitality. The crew are really friendly and warm. They started with champagne and non-alcoholic beverages before take off. They even offer a top up for my champagne too, which is a bonus. Shortly after take-off, the crew starts serving more drinks and some light snacks. Then, they serve the signature satay. I chose both the chicken and beef satays and the satays truly live up to their name and reputation! For lunch, I chose the Tasmanian salmon for entree, pre-ordered curry chicken with rice through chef-on-board, and seasonal fruit as dessert. Lunch is beautiful and full of flavour. Midway through the flight, I ordered a plate of vegetarian mee goreng or fried noodles which is quite delicious. Before landing, the crew goes around with another round of food. This time I choose the ham and egg sandwich. By this time, I feel like I am truly well fed by the crew. The cabin crew have also shown exceptional services through the little things that they do. For example, when they see my empty water bottle, they offer to refill it for me. The crew is super friendly, chatty and one of them has even given me a private tour of the aircraft, including helping me to solve a lifelong mystery - where do cabin crew get their rest during an ultra long haul flight! If I could rate this experience a 11 out of 10, this flight is definitely the one!

route: Hyderabad to Kuala Lumpur via Sydney
review: Hyderabad to Kuala Lumpur via Sydney with Malaysia Airlines. Smooth check-in, seats were spacious and that's about it. Suffice to say that the food on both the flights was horrible. The snack they provided just before landing in Sydney was the worst I have ever had. Not only is the food horrible, but they seem to forget the fact that people have their dinner, at the time they land in Sydney. They seem to get it completely wrong. Top it up with a pretty ordinary collection of movies and TV shows on offer, it was a forgettable experience. Not worth it. Definitely booking with other airlines for my next flight.

route: Penang to Hong Kong via Kuala Lumpur
review: Penang to Hong Kong via Kuala Lumpur. Poor service from Malaysia Airlines. Arrived to airport on time and took my flight as planned from Penang to Kuala Lumpur. During the connection to my flight to Hong Kong, I had to clear immigration which was ridiculously long for foreigners (finger print, stamps, the works) and get from one end of the airport to the other. Malaysia Airlines did not allocate enough time for a passenger to reasonably make it through these steps to the connecting flight. Upon finally clearing immigration, we ran to the gate where they informed us they had just closed the boarding doors and that we would need to pay a USD $200 to get on the next flight. Explained the situation to the duty manager who also refused to accommodate us on the next available flight. When we did everything right, and Malaysia Airlines left us behind and demanded we pay for it. Luckily, Cathay Pacific had several flights available and we had a wonderful experience flying with them, instead, to Hong Kong. Overall, ridiculously poor service from Malaysia Airlines and their food was bad, seats too cramped, wifi didn't work, and staff were rude. Fly Cathay Pacific, not Malaysia Airlines for a better experience!

Kuala Lumpur to Auckland. The cabin staff were polite but untrained and incompetent. The food was the worst I've had in business class. The inflight entertainment was very limited. The seat layout was good but the squab of my seat was damaged and uncomfortable. I wrote a complaint to the Airline, their response was prompt and courteous. But I was left with the feeling that nothing will be done to improve things. This was my first time with Malaysia Airlines and it will be my last.

Travelling from Siem Reap to Kuala Lumpur with Malaysia Airlines. Efficient baggage drop service, friendly and helpful cabin crews. Clear announcement from cabin crews and pilot during take off and landing. Food was good. Lots of leg room and the hand luggage storage was great as it easily fit in my 70 litre rucksack. Flight arrived on time.

route: Singapore to London via Kuala Lumpur
review: Singapore to London via Kuala Lumpur with A380 and A350. For the long haul flight, the staff are accommodating, i can see that they are tired but trying to accomodate us as much as possible. Transfer in KL is with no hassle, just need to check the boarding gate (no carrying baggage, custom immigration clearance etc).

route: Hyderabad to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur
review: Hyderabad to Sydney via Kuala Lumpur. We requested for Hindu meal when booking and i can see that on our online booking. But on the flight they didn't know about it and offered us the regular meal. Overall the standard of food was poor. No kids meal was prebooked and was not available on demand. Food quality was really bad even on our way to India from Sydney.

Kuala Lumpur to Singapore. Flight departed on time & arrived early. Light refreshments of salted peanuts & orange juice were served on this short journey. Cabin crew were professional. Unfortunately, the aircon was not working properly throughout the flight & so it was really warm, considering it was in the afternoon. Would have been unbearable on a longer flight.

Manila to Kuala Lumpur. Check-in online was a disaster, not designed for doing that with your phone at all, especially not for seat selection. Contacted Malaysia, said I can just go to the counter, no options to upgrade the seat what so ever. Staff at the gate is unfriendly, want you to open the bag eventhough it already passed airport security X-ray. On board entertainment is limited and the system is old. Would never fly Malaysia Airlines again. It was a KLM flight operated by Malasiya Airlines.

route: Sydney to Bangalore  via Kuala Lumpur
